name: LB-t
one_line_profile: Multi-threaded object-oriented LBM CFD solver for 3D incompressible flows
detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics code implementing the Lattice-Boltzmann method (LBM) for three-dimensional incompressible fluid flow. It supports general lattices (D2Q9, D3Q15, etc.) and is written in C++17 with OpenMP parallelization.

name: PeleC
one_line_profile: AMR code for compressible reacting flow simulations
detailed_description: An adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) solver for compressible reacting flows, built on the AMReX framework. It is designed for high-performance simulations of combustion and compressible fluid dynamics.

name: CAMR
one_line_profile: AMR code for compressible flow simulation
detailed_description: A compressible flow solver utilizing adaptive mesh refinement (AMR), part of the AMReX-Fluids ecosystem. It serves as a core component for simulating compressible fluid dynamics phenomena.

name: IAMR
one_line_profile: Parallel AMR code for variable-density incompressible Navier-Stokes equations
detailed_description: A parallel, adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) code that solves the variable-density incompressible Navier-Stokes equations. It is built on the AMReX framework and is suitable for large-scale fluid simulations.

name: incflo
one_line_profile: Incompressible Navier-Stokes solver for complex geometries
detailed_description: An incompressible Navier-Stokes solver designed for complex geometries, leveraging the AMReX framework for adaptive mesh refinement. It is often used in coupled multi-physics simulations.

name: Basilisk (Astrodynamics)
one_line_profile: Astrodynamics simulation framework
detailed_description: A modular and fast astrodynamics simulation framework capable of simulating complex spacecraft dynamics and control systems. Note: This is distinct from the CFD solver also named Basilisk.

name: bsk_rl
one_line_profile: RL environments and tools for spacecraft autonomy research
detailed_description: A library providing Reinforcement Learning (RL) environments and tools for spacecraft autonomy research, built on top of the Basilisk astrodynamics framework.

name: DLBFoam
one_line_profile: Dynamic load balancing model for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: An open-source dynamic load balancing library for OpenFOAM, specifically optimized for fast reacting flow simulations with uneven computational loads.

name: AMR-LBM-OpenMP-2D
one_line_profile: AMR-LBM solver for multiphase flows
detailed_description: A numerical simulation tool utilizing the Lattice-Boltzmann Method (LBM) with Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) for multiphase flows, parallelized with OpenMP.

name: Improved_Phase-Field_LBM_2D
one_line_profile: Improved conservative phase-field LBM code for multiphase flows
detailed_description: A Fortran implementation of an improved conservative phase-field Lattice Boltzmann Method for simulating multiphase flows in 2D periodic domains.

name: flowTorch
one_line_profile: Library for analysis and reduced-order modeling of fluid flows
detailed_description: A Python library designed for the analysis and reduced-order modeling (ROM) of fluid flow data, integrating with PyTorch for machine learning applications in fluid dynamics.

name: pimpleTKEBudgetFoam
one_line_profile: OpenFOAM solver for runtime turbulence statistics
detailed_description: An OpenFOAM solver extension to calculate resolved Reynolds stress, turbulent kinetic energy, and dissipation rate at runtime during Large Eddy Simulations (LES).

name: Omega2D
one_line_profile: 2D flow solver using vortex particle and boundary element methods
detailed_description: A two-dimensional fluid flow solver featuring a GUI, utilizing vortex particle methods and boundary element methods for simulation.

name: XLB
one_line_profile: Accelerated Lattice Boltzmann for Physics-based ML
detailed_description: A high-performance, differentiable Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) solver implemented in JAX, designed for physics-based machine learning and inverse design problems.

name: VISCOPLASTIC-LBM
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated LBM software for flow simulation
detailed_description: A Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) software package for fluid flow simulation, featuring GPU acceleration for high performance.

name: TCLB
one_line_profile: Templated MPI+CUDA/CPU Lattice Boltzmann code
detailed_description: A high-performance, templated Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) solver supporting MPI and CUDA/CPU execution for large-scale fluid simulations.

name: Euler2D-KFVS
one_line_profile: 2D Euler equations solver using kinetic flux vector splitting
detailed_description: A 2D solver for Euler equations on quadrilateral grids, utilizing the kinetic flux vector splitting (KFVS) scheme, written in Object-Oriented Fortran 2003.

name: CaLES
one_line_profile: Canonical direct and large-eddy simulation solver
detailed_description: A solver for canonical direct numerical simulations (DNS) and large-eddy simulations (LES), part of the CaNS ecosystem for high-fidelity fluid dynamics.

name: CaNS
one_line_profile: Fast, massively-parallel DNS code for canonical flows
detailed_description: A code designed for fast, massively-parallel Direct Numerical Simulations (DNS) of canonical fluid flows, widely used in turbulence research.

name: Tsunamis.jl

detailed_description: A Julia-based solver for Shallow Water Equations using the Finite Volume Method and HLLE Riemann Solver, supporting parallel execution.

name: sdfibm

name: 2DTFIGridGeneration

detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation for efficient adaptive mesh coarsening in 2D, complementing adaptive refinement strategies in FEM/CFD.

name: smeshing

name: cutcell

name: gpu-amr

name: CFD-Simulation-in-Porous-Medium

name: MeshAnything

detailed_description: The second version of MeshAnything, improving mesh generation quality and efficiency using adjacent mesh tokenization techniques.

detailed_description: A converter tool that translates mesh files from Gmsh format to CalculiX input format, facilitating the workflow between meshing and FEA solving.

detailed_description: A C library for dynamic management of a collection (forest) of octrees, enabling parallel adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) for PDE solvers.

name: Feature-Preserving-Octree-Hex-Meshing

detailed_description: A C++ tool for generating hexahedral meshes using an octree-based voxelization approach that preserves geometric features. Hexahedral meshes are critical for high-quality structural and fluid simulations.

name: Robust-Hexahedral-Re-Meshing

detailed_description: A tool for the simplification and optimization of hexahedral meshes, improving mesh quality for finite element analysis.

name: Text2Robot

name: libgeodecomp

detailed_description: A C++ library for high-performance computer simulations, supporting stencil codes, mesh-free methods, unstructured grids, and N-body particle methods. It is designed to scale from mobile devices to petascale supercomputers.

name: GetFEM

name: GIBBON

detailed_description: A Julia library that provides an interface to use Gmsh-generated meshes within the Gridap ecosystem, enabling finite element simulations on complex geometries.

name: P4est_wrapper.jl

detailed_description: A Julia wrapper for the p4est C library, which manages a collection of adaptive octrees in parallel. It is a critical component for AMR capabilities in the Gridap ecosystem.

name: tin-terrain
one_line_profile: Command-line tool for converting GeoTIFF heightmaps into optimized tiled meshes
detailed_description: A specialized tool for processing geospatial data, specifically converting heightmaps (GeoTIFF) into Triangulated Irregular Networks (TIN) or optimized meshes. It supports tile-based generation suitable for large-scale terrain visualization and simulation environments.

name: ManifoldPlus
one_line_profile: Robust watertight manifold surface generation method for triangle soups
detailed_description: A geometry processing tool that converts arbitrary triangle soups (non-manifold, self-intersecting meshes) into watertight manifold surfaces. It is critical for preparing geometric models for physics simulations (CFD, FEM) where mesh topology quality is essential.

name: hopest

name: HOPR

name: gmodel

name: tetgen

detailed_description: A Python interface developed by NASA for 'refine', a mesh adaptation tool. It allows for scripting and automation of mesh adaptation processes in computational fluid dynamics workflows.

name: SOLVERLAB
one_line_profile: PDE solver lab using SALOME/MEDCoupling meshes and PETSc matrices
detailed_description: SOLVERLAB is a development environment for Partial Differential Equation (PDE) solvers. It integrates mesh management via SALOME/MEDCoupling and linear algebra via PETSc, providing a framework for scientific computing.

name: Neper
one_line_profile: Software for polycrystal generation and meshing
detailed_description: Neper is a software package for generating and meshing polycrystals. It can generate synthetic microstructures with specific statistical properties and create high-quality meshes for finite element analysis.

name: nii2mesh
one_line_profile: Tool to convert NIfTI medical volumes to triangulated meshes
detailed_description: A C utility that converts NIfTI volume data (commonly used in medical imaging) into triangulated meshes (OBJ, STL, etc.) using the marching cubes algorithm, facilitating the use of medical data in simulation and visualization.

name: GradientAMR
one_line_profile: Gradient-based Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) criteria for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: A library and set of examples for OpenFOAM that implements Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) strategies based on the gradient of flow variables, improving simulation efficiency by refining meshes only where necessary.

name: salomeToOpenFOAM
one_line_profile: Converter from Salome mesh format to OpenFOAM
detailed_description: A Python script designed to bridge the gap between the Salome platform (pre-processing/meshing) and OpenFOAM (CFD solver) by converting mesh files, facilitating the workflow between these two open-source scientific tools.

name: volume_distribution
one_line_profile: Algorithm for distributing 3D vectors inside a mesh
detailed_description: A Python tool for generating distributions of 3D vectors within a mesh volume, useful for particle seeding, initial condition generation, or sampling in scientific simulations.

name: mmgdynamics
one_line_profile: MMG Standard model for ship maneuvering simulation
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the MMG (Manoeuvring Modelling Group) standard model for simulating ship maneuvering dynamics, including extensions for environmental factors like currents, winds, and shallow water.

name: discretization-robust-correspondence-benchmark

detailed_description: A benchmarking tool and dataset designed to evaluate the robustness of 3D machine learning models against different surface discretizations and remeshing, aiding in the development of geometry-aware AI models.

name: Gmsh.Net

detailed_description: A C# wrapper for the Gmsh library, enabling .NET developers to utilize Gmsh's powerful finite element mesh generation capabilities within their scientific or engineering applications.

name: pygmsh
one_line_profile: Python interface for Gmsh
detailed_description: A popular Python library that provides a pythonic interface to Gmsh, allowing users to generate complex finite element meshes using Python scripts, widely used in scientific computing workflows.

name: LLaMA-Mesh
one_line_profile: Unified 3D Mesh Generation with Language Models
detailed_description: A research tool that adapts Large Language Models (LLMs) for 3D mesh generation, enabling the synthesis of 3D geometry from text prompts, bridging the gap between NLP and 3D scientific visualization/modeling.

name: MMGX
one_line_profile: Multiple Molecular Graph eXplainable Discovery
detailed_description: A tool for molecular discovery using graph-based explainable AI methods, assisting researchers in understanding molecular properties and structures through graph representations.

name: Cassiopee
one_line_profile: CFD pre- and post-processing Python modules by ONERA
detailed_description: A comprehensive library developed by ONERA for CFD pre- and post-processing, including mesh manipulation, CGNS tree handling, and data extraction, tailored for aerospace research.

name: FreeTO
one_line_profile: Freeform 3D topology optimization in MATLAB
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for 3D topology optimization using structured meshes, allowing for the generation of smooth boundaries in structural design and physics simulations.

name: MMGeneration
one_line_profile: Toolkit for generative models based on PyTorch
detailed_description: A powerful toolkit from OpenMMLab for generative models (GANs, Diffusion, etc.), widely used in AI research for image synthesis and data augmentation, applicable to scientific data generation tasks.

name: bitpit

detailed_description: A C++ library designed for high-performance computing in scientific applications, providing modules for mesh handling (octree, unstructured), parallel communication, and geometric operations, developed by Optimad.

name: Surface-Remesher

detailed_description: A C++ tool for high-quality surface remeshing based on Centroidal Voronoi Tessellation (CVT), useful for improving mesh quality in geometry processing and simulation workflows.

name: Dendro-GR

detailed_description: Dendro-GR is a framework for high-performance computational physics, specifically designed for numerical relativity. It utilizes octree-based wavelet adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) to solve Einstein's equations efficiently on large-scale supercomputers.

name: AirfoilMesh

detailed_description: A Python library that provides a wrapper around the ACVD (Approximated Centroidal Voronoi Diagrams) algorithm for uniform resampling of surface meshes, essential for improving mesh quality in scientific computing and visualization.

name: scikit-gmsh

detailed_description: A Python library that provides a scikit-style interface to the Gmsh mesh generator, allowing users to define geometries and generate 3D finite element meshes programmatically within Python workflows.

name: PostMesh

name: gridgen-c

detailed_description: A C library and utility for generating orthogonal grids, particularly useful for oceanography and fluid dynamics simulations requiring specific grid topologies.

name: Project-FEA

detailed_description: A C++ Finite Element library designed for flexibility, allowing users to easily define and solve new weak forms for various physical models.

name: LaB-GATr

name: mini-wake

detailed_description: A lightweight Python implementation of the Ainslie eddy viscosity wake model and associated sub-models, used for calculating wind turbine wake effects.

one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of Dynamic Mode Decomposition
detailed_description: A MATLAB library implementing Dynamic Mode Decomposition (DMD) for analyzing fluid dynamics and other time-series data.

name: odmd
one_line_profile: Online and Window Dynamic Mode Decomposition
detailed_description: Python implementation of Online DMD and Window DMD algorithms for real-time or streaming analysis of dynamical systems.

name: atomizationFoam
one_line_profile: Spray atomization simulation solver for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: An OpenFOAM solver coupling Volume-of-Fluid (VOF) and Lagrangian Particle Tracking (LPT) for simulating spray atomization processes.

name: KQCircuits
one_line_profile: KLayout Python library for integrated quantum circuit design
detailed_description: A tool for generating KLayout macros and PCells for superconducting quantum circuits, facilitating the design and fabrication of quantum processors.

name: EMC-ParaView
one_line_profile: ParaView plugins for Earth Model Collaboration data
detailed_description: A set of Python programmable filters and sources for ParaView to visualize EMC netCDF and GeoCSV models for Earth Science research.

name: poseviz
one_line_profile: 3D Human Pose Visualizer for Python
detailed_description: A lightweight visualization tool for 3D human pose estimation results, useful in biomechanics and computer vision research.

name: IMAS-ParaView
one_line_profile: ParaView plugins for visualizing IMAS fusion data
detailed_description: ParaView plugins developed by the ITER Organization for visualizing General Grid Descriptions (GGDs) and other data adhering to the IMAS (Integrated Modelling and Analysis Suite) standard.

name: PlutoVista.jl
one_line_profile: Visualization library for Pluto notebooks using vtk.js
detailed_description: A Julia library providing interactive 1D, 2D, and 3D visualizations in Pluto notebooks, leveraging plotly.js and vtk.js for scientific data plotting.

name: SciBlend-Core
one_line_profile: Bridge between ParaView and Blender for high-quality scientific visualization
detailed_description: A Blender add-on that facilitates the import of scientific visualization data from ParaView into Blender. It streamlines the process of setting up scenes and animations for high-fidelity rendering of CFD and physics simulation results.

name: DiffGeoOps
one_line_profile: Discrete differential geometry operators for triangulated 2-manifolds
detailed_description: A Python implementation of discrete differential-geometry operators (such as curvature estimation) for triangulated surfaces, based on the paper by Meyer et al. Useful for geometric analysis of meshes in physics simulations.

name: MidSurfer
one_line_profile: ParaView plugin for extracting mid-surfaces from volumetric masks
detailed_description: A ParaView plugin developed by KAUST Vislab designed to extract mid-surfaces from binary segmentation masks. This is particularly useful in analyzing thin structures in volumetric scientific data.

name: POD-RBF
one_line_profile: Reduced Order Modeling using POD and Radial Basis Functions
detailed_description: A Python library for constructing Reduced Order Models (ROMs) using Proper Orthogonal Decomposition (POD) coupled with Radial Basis Function (RBF) networks. It is used for accelerating physics simulations and flow field reconstruction.

name: vedo
one_line_profile: Scientific analysis and visualization of 3D data
detailed_description: A powerful Python module for scientific analysis and visualization of 3D objects and point clouds. It is based on VTK and NumPy, providing a high-level interface for handling meshes, volumes, and simulations in physics and engineering.

name: MODULO
one_line_profile: Multiscale Modal Analysis software for numerical and experimental data
detailed_description: MODULO (MODal mULtiscale pOd) is a software package developed at the von Karman Institute for performing Multiscale Modal Analysis on numerical and experimental datasets using the Multiscale Proper Orthogonal Decomposition (mPOD) method. It aids in decomposing complex flow fields into dominant modes.

name: pv_atmos
one_line_profile: ParaView scripting for atmospheric netCDF data visualization
detailed_description: A Python package designed to facilitate the visualization of atmospheric science data (specifically netCDF formats) using ParaView. It provides scripts and utilities to handle specific atmospheric data structures and rendering requirements.

name: apyce-project
one_line_profile: 3D visualization wrapper for reservoir grids
detailed_description: A Python-based Builder/Eclipse wrapper designed for the 3D visualization of reservoir grids. It serves as a tool for reservoir engineering to visualize simulation data and grid structures.

name: swSim

detailed_description: Solid Wave Simulation (swSim) solves heterogeneous, anisotropic elastodynamic equations for ultrasonic Non-Destructive Evaluation (NDE) simulation. It uses a time-explicit staggered grid finite difference scheme accelerated by GPUs and outputs data in VTK format.

name: surf-ice
one_line_profile: GLSL surface rendering tool for neuroimaging and mesh formats
detailed_description: A visualization tool for surface rendering using GLSL. It supports a wide range of scientific mesh and tractography formats (NIfTI, GIfTI, VTK, OBJ, etc.), primarily used in neuroimaging but applicable to general mesh visualization.

name: gwpv
one_line_profile: Gravitational wave data visualization with ParaView
detailed_description: A Python toolkit for visualizing gravitational wave simulation data using ParaView. It provides specific data loaders and rendering configurations for astrophysical simulations.

name: meshio

detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library for reading and writing unstructured meshes in various formats (VTK, Gmsh, ANSYS, Abaqus, etc.). It is a fundamental tool for data conversion and pre/post-processing in computational physics.

name: OMD

detailed_description: A Matlab package developed by the Oxford Control Group for computing Optimal Mode Decomposition (OMD) and Dynamic Mode Decomposition (DMD). It is used for analyzing dynamics in fluid flows and other time-series data.

name: PyEVTK
one_line_profile: Export data to binary VTK files
detailed_description: A Python package that allows exporting data to binary VTK files for visualization and data analysis. It supports various VTK formats (RectilinearGrid, StructuredGrid, UnstructuredGrid, etc.) and is widely used in scientific computing pipelines.

name: gcode2vtk

detailed_description: A utility tool that converts G-code (numerical control programming language used in 3D printing) into VTK files, enabling the visualization of printing paths and layers in scientific visualization software like ParaView.

name: dash-vtk

name: PRISMA2020

name: SKDMD

detailed_description: A Python package implementing Sparsity-promoting Kernel Dynamic Mode Decomposition (SKDMD), a data-driven modeling technique used for analyzing nonlinear dynamical systems in physics and engineering.

name: nuscenes_viz

name: PyVista

name: pyvista-xarray

detailed_description: An interactive application designed for rapid prototyping and testing of VTK visualization pipelines using a QML-based interface, useful for developing scientific visualization workflows.

detailed_description: Implementation of a deep adaptive sampling method designed to efficiently solve high-dimensional partial differential equations.

detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for solving ordinary and partial differential equations (ODEs/PDEs) using neural networks, designed for ease of use in research and education.

name: PML-UCF PINN

detailed_description: A Python package for implementing and training Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) for solving forward and inverse problems in physics.

name: PaddleScience

detailed_description: An SDK and library for developing AI-driven scientific computing applications, supporting various physics-informed learning tasks.

name: NeuralSolvers

detailed_description: A PyTorch library implementing physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) for solving partial differential equations and inverse problems, featuring various neural network architectures and training strategies.

name: PINN-elastodynamics

detailed_description: A specific implementation of Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINN) designed to solve elastodynamics problems, serving as a reference solver for solid mechanics simulations.

name: PINN-laminar-flow

detailed_description: A PINN-based solver specifically tailored for laminar flow problems in fluid dynamics, providing a reference implementation for AI-driven CFD tasks.

name: PINN-pBTE

detailed_description: A specialized Physics-Informed Neural Network solver for the Phonon Boltzmann Transport Equation (pBTE), addressing multiscale heat transport problems.

detailed_description: A comprehensive Julia library for Scientific Machine Learning (SciML), integrating differential equation solvers with neural networks (Neural ODEs, SDEs, DAEs) for physics-informed modeling and simulation.

name: FluxNeuralOperators.jl

name: NeuralPDE.jl

name: OperatorLearning.jl

detailed_description: A Julia library focused on operator learning techniques for scientific machine learning, enabling the learning of mappings between infinite-dimensional function spaces.

name: PINN-for-NS-equation

detailed_description: A widely-starred PyTorch implementation of Physics-Informed Neural Networks specifically for solving the two-dimensional Navier-Stokes equations, serving as a standard reference solver.

detailed_description: An implementation of Physics-Informed DeepONet (Deep Operator Network) from scratch, enabling operator learning with physical constraints.

detailed_description: Implementation of the Wavelet Neural Operator (WNO) for solving parametric partial differential equations in computational mechanics.

name: PINN-Battery-Prognostics

name: Sophon.jl

detailed_description: A Julia library designed to streamline and accelerate the training of Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs), offering optimized performance for scientific machine learning tasks.

name: continuiti

detailed_description: A Python library for learning function operators (like Neural Operators) using neural networks, facilitating data-driven modeling of continuous systems.

name: twophasePINN

detailed_description: A specialized PINN implementation for solving complex two-phase flow problems in fluid dynamics.

name: Fourier-Neural-Operator

detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of the Fourier Neural Operator (FNO) for solving partial differential equations, serving as a reusable component for operator learning tasks.

name: FourierFlow

name: PyDEns

name: hep_ml

detailed_description: A library implementing Geometric Neural Operators (GNPs) for performing machine learning tasks on point-cloud representations, including curvature estimation, shape deformation, and solving geometric PDEs.

name: pinnfactory
one_line_profile: Lightweight framework for building Physics-Informed Neural Networks
detailed_description: A framework for constructing PINNs using symbolic PDE definitions with SymPy and PyTorch. It automates loss generation and supports flexible neural architectures for forward and inverse problems.

name: FBPINNs
one_line_profile: Finite Basis Physics-Informed Neural Networks solver
detailed_description: A library implementing Finite Basis Physics-Informed Neural Networks (FBPINNs) for solving forward and inverse PDE problems. It uses domain decomposition and local basis functions to improve scalability and accuracy.

name: PYRO-NN
one_line_profile: Python Reconstruction Operators in Neural Networks
detailed_description: A high-level Python API for reconstruction operators (like Radon transform) in neural networks, primarily used for medical imaging and physics-based reconstruction tasks.

name: AL4PDE

detailed_description: A benchmarking suite designed to evaluate active learning strategies for neural PDE solvers. It provides a standardized environment for testing how different data sampling strategies affect the performance of neural PDE models.

name: hp-VPINNs
one_line_profile: Variational Physics-Informed Neural Networks framework with domain decomposition
detailed_description: A general framework implementing hp-Variational Physics-Informed Neural Networks (hp-VPINNs) which utilizes domain decomposition and projection-based loss functions to solve differential equations.

name: JAX-CFD
one_line_profile: Computational Fluid Dynamics solver library in JAX
detailed_description: A library for writing computational fluid dynamics (CFD) solvers using JAX. It enables differentiable fluid simulations and seamless integration with machine learning models for physics-based deep learning.

name: PINNacle
one_line_profile: Comprehensive benchmark suite for Physics-Informed Neural Networks
detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark dataset and evaluation platform for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs). It provides diverse PDE problems and standardized evaluation metrics to compare different PINN variants.

name: IDRLnet

detailed_description: A Python toolbox for modeling and solving differential equations using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs). It provides a systematic framework for defining geometry, physics constraints, and training neural solvers.

name: GlobalTomo

detailed_description: The first global synthetic dataset designed for physics-ML seismic wavefield modeling and full-waveform inversion (FWI), providing a benchmark for geophysical AI models.

name: DeepONet

detailed_description: A standalone implementation of Deep Operator Networks (DeepONet) for learning nonlinear operators from data, serving as a foundational codebase for operator learning before integration into larger libraries.

name: DeepXDE
one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for physics-informed machine learning and scientific computing
detailed_description: A powerful and widely used library for scientific machine learning, offering extensive support for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs), DeepONets, and other neural PDE solvers across various backends (TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX, PaddlePaddle).

name: PINA
one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural networks for Advanced modeling
detailed_description: A Python package providing an intuitive interface for solving differential equations using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs), featuring various architectures and optimization strategies.

name: ml4chem

detailed_description: A library for implementing machine learning models in chemistry and materials science, providing tools for atomistic simulations and property prediction.

name: NeuralGCM

detailed_description: A general circulation model (GCM) that combines physics-based modeling with machine learning components to simulate the Earth's atmosphere efficiently and accurately.

name: neuraloperator

detailed_description: The official implementation of Fourier Neural Operator (FNO) and other neural operator architectures. It provides a framework for learning mappings between infinite-dimensional function spaces, widely used for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) in physics and engineering.

name: NodeLab
one_line_profile: MATLAB repository for node generation and meshfree method implementation
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for generating nodes and performing adaptive refinement, specifically designed to support the implementation and testing of meshfree methods such as Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and DeepONet for solving PDEs.

name: PINNs-TF2.0
one_line_profile: TensorFlow 2.0 implementation of Physics Informed Neural Networks
detailed_description: A widely used reference implementation and solver framework for Physics Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) using TensorFlow 2.0, porting the original TensorFlow 1.x codebase to the modern ecosystem.

name: pinns-tf2

detailed_description: A structured implementation of Physics-informed Neural Networks (PINNs) in TensorFlow V2, serving as a reusable solver framework for solving forward and inverse PDE problems.

name: pinns-torch

detailed_description: A comprehensive PyTorch implementation of Physics-informed Neural Networks (PINNs), providing a robust codebase for researchers to solve partial differential equations using deep learning.

name: torch-cfd

detailed_description: A PyTorch library designed to accelerate Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations using Neural Operators. It provides tools for coupling deep learning models with traditional CFD solvers.

name: neurop_invdes

detailed_description: A Python library providing neural operator-based surrogate models specifically designed for electromagnetic inverse design tasks, enabling faster optimization compared to traditional simulation methods.

name: NUNO

detailed_description: Implementation of the Non-Uniform Neural Operator (NUNO), a deep learning architecture designed to efficiently solve partial differential equations on non-uniform discretization grids.

detailed_description: A library aggregating various neural network-based PDE solvers, providing a unified interface for training, evaluation, and benchmarking of AI4Science models.

detailed_description: A MATLAB-based software tool for Earth observation tasks, leveraging machine learning for data processing and providing visualization capabilities compatible with Google Maps and WebGL Earth.

detailed_description: A specialized Physics-Informed Neural Network (PINN) implementation designed for estimating the State of Health (SOH) of batteries, combining electrochemical models with data-driven approaches.

name: OpenDataCapture

name: ROSE-ROM4FOAM

detailed_description: A library implementing Reduced Order Modelling (ROM) techniques specifically designed for Data Assimilation tasks within the OpenFOAM CFD environment.

name: CONES

name: global-workflow

name: OpenDA

detailed_description: OpenDA is an open interface standard and a set of tools for data assimilation (DA) and calibration of numerical models. It provides a generic framework to connect arbitrary models (e.g., CFD, hydrology) with various DA algorithms (EnKF, particle filters, etc.) without modifying the model code significantly.

name: FengWu-4DVar
one_line_profile: Coupling large weather models with 4DVar data assimilation
detailed_description: A framework integrating the FengWu global weather forecast model with 4D-Var (Four-Dimensional Variational) data assimilation techniques. It aims to improve initial condition accuracy for AI-based weather forecasting by assimilating observational data.

name: PDAF
one_line_profile: Parallel Data Assimilation Framework for high-performance computing
detailed_description: PDAF (Parallel Data Assimilation Framework) is a software framework for data assimilation with numerical models. It provides fully implemented and parallelized ensemble-based data assimilation algorithms (like EnKF, LETKF) and is designed to be linked to existing simulation models (e.g., for oceanography or meteorology).

name: fmr-enkf
one_line_profile: Fast Multipole Method accelerated Ensemble Kalman Filters
detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of Ensemble Kalman Filters (EnKFs) accelerated by the Fast Multipole Method (FMM) and Randomized Low-Rank Approximations. It addresses the computational bottleneck in high-dimensional data assimilation problems.

name: hybrid-godas

name: DIFFICE_jax

detailed_description: A differentiable neural-network based solver written in JAX for data assimilation in ice shelf dynamics. It leverages automatic differentiation to optimize ice flow parameters against observational data.

name: ecmwf-opendata

name: SDA (Score-based Data Assimilation)

detailed_description: A Python library implementing Score-based Data Assimilation, a method that combines score-based generative models (diffusion models) with physical measurement operators to solve inverse problems and data assimilation tasks in scientific modeling.

name: EQDiscovery
one_line_profile: Physics-informed learning of governing equations from scarce data
detailed_description: A framework for discovering governing physical equations from scarce and noisy data using physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) and sparse regression. It addresses the problem of system identification in scientific modeling.

name: CIROH_DL_NextGen

detailed_description: A research framework designed to integrate and test deep learning (DL) and physics-informed machine learning (PIML) streamflow models, along with data assimilation techniques, within NOAAs Next Generation Water Modeling Engine prototype. It supports hydrological modeling and forecasting workflows.

name: DAPPER

detailed_description: A Python package designed for experimental research in Data Assimilation (DA). It provides implementations of various DA methods (EnKF, Particle Filters, etc.) and benchmark models to facilitate the development and comparison of DA algorithms.

name: openDAQ
one_line_profile: Open-source SDK for data acquisition systems
detailed_description: A professional SDK for Data Acquisition (DAQ) that allows connection to compatible DAQ devices, streaming of data, and integration into measurement systems. Essential for experimental physics and engineering data collection.

name: OpenDataCam

detailed_description: An open-source tool that uses computer vision (YOLO) to quantify and track moving objects in video feeds. It is used for scientific observation in urban science, traffic analysis, and field studies to generate structured data from video.

name: OpenDataVal

detailed_description: A Python framework implementing Four-Dimensional Ensemble Variational (4D-EnVar) data assimilation methods, specifically designed for land surface models to fuse observational data with model states.

detailed_description: A Python library implementing various Kalman filters (KF, EKF, UKF) and other optimal estimation algorithms (particle filters, H-Infinity), serving as a core utility for data assimilation and state estimation tasks.

name: 4DVarFormer

name: DAFI

detailed_description: A C++ framework for ensemble-based data assimilation and field inversion, designed for high-performance physics simulations and parameter estimation.

name: AI-VarDA

detailed_description: A modular data assimilation framework that supports both traditional variational algorithms and AI-based methods (like FengWu-4DVar, VAE-Var), featuring pluggable interfaces for forecast models.

name: pyPDAF

detailed_description: Provides a Python interface to the Parallel Data Assimilation Framework (PDAF), enabling the use of high-performance ensemble data assimilation methods from Python.

name: TensorVar
one_line_profile: Efficient four-dimensional variational data assimilation (4DVar) solver
detailed_description: An implementation of four-dimensional variational data assimilation (4DVar) leveraging tensor operations for efficiency, suitable for atmospheric and oceanic data assimilation research.

name: ACCESS-OM2

detailed_description: The ACCESS-OM2 is a global coupled ocean-sea ice model developed by the Australian Community Climate and Earth System Simulator (ACCESS). It serves as a key component for climate modeling and oceanographic research.

name: MAESTROeX

detailed_description: MAESTROeX is a C++ code based on AMReX for simulating low Mach number stellar hydrodynamics. It is designed for modeling long-time evolution of astrophysical flows where sound waves can be filtered out.

name: Microphysics

detailed_description: A collection of common astrophysical microphysics routines (nuclear networks, equations of state, opacity) designed with interfaces for integration into various AMReX-based simulation codes like Castro and MAESTROeX.

name: Nyx

detailed_description: Nyx is a massively parallel, adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) code for cosmological simulations. It solves equations for N-body dark matter and compressible hydrodynamics of baryonic gas to model the evolution of the universe.

name: Amrvis

detailed_description: Amrvis is a specialized visualization tool designed to read, display, and analyze output and profiling data from scientific simulation codes built on the AMReX framework.

name: AMReX
one_line_profile: Software framework for block-structured adaptive mesh refinement
detailed_description: AMReX is a software framework designed for building massively parallel, block-structured adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) applications. It supports solving systems of partial differential equations on hierarchical grids with GPU acceleration.

name: pyamrex
one_line_profile: GPU-enabled zero-copy Python bindings for AMReX
detailed_description: pyamrex provides Python bindings for the AMReX framework, enabling zero-copy data exchange between C++ AMReX kernels and Python environments. It facilitates the integration of AI/ML workflows with high-performance AMR simulations.

name: PeleAnalysis
one_line_profile: Processing tools for reacting flow simulations with AMReX
detailed_description: A collection of post-processing and analysis tools specifically designed for reacting flow simulations generated by AMReX-based CFD codes (Pele suite).

name: PeleLMeX
one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh solver for low Mach number reacting flows
detailed_description: PeleLMeX is an adaptive mesh hydrodynamics simulation code for low Mach number reacting flows. It is an evolution of PeleLM, offering improved performance and scalability for combustion research.

name: PeleMP
one_line_profile: Multiphysics models for the Pele combustion suite
detailed_description: PeleMP provides multiphysics models (such as spray and soot models) for use with the Pele suite of combustion codes (PeleC, PeleLMeX).

name: PelePhysics

detailed_description: PelePhysics is a library containing physics databases (thermodynamics, transport, chemistry) and implementation code shared across the Pele suite of combustion solvers.

name: FHDeX

detailed_description: FHDeX provides AMReX-enabled code libraries for stochastic hybrid models and algorithms for fluids, specifically focusing on fluctuating hydrodynamics.

name: LBMeX

detailed_description: LBMeX implements Lattice Boltzmann methods (LBM) using the AMReX software framework, enabling scalable parallel simulations of fluid flows on structured grids.

name: AMReX-Hydro

detailed_description: AMReX-Hydro is a collection of hydrodynamic routines and solvers built on the AMReX framework, providing reusable components for fluid dynamics simulations.

name: ELEQTRONeX

detailed_description: ELEQTRONeX is a simulation framework based on the nonequilibrium Green's function (NEGF) method for modeling electrostatic-quantum transport in field-effect transistors (FETs).

name: FerroX

detailed_description: FerroX is a massively parallel, 3D phase-field simulation framework designed for modeling ferroelectric materials and scalable logic devices using AMReX.

name: artemis

detailed_description: ARTEMIS couples Maxwell's equations solvers with classical equations for quantum material behavior (e.g., micromagnetics, superconductivity) to quantify the performance of next-generation microelectronics.

name: flowtorch

detailed_description: flowTorch is a Python library designed for the analysis and reduced-order modeling (ROM) of fluid flow data. It leverages PyTorch to integrate machine learning techniques with fluid dynamics analysis.

name: Omega3D

name: ImpactX

name: WarpX

detailed_description: WarpX is an advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell (PIC) code designed for simulating laser-plasma interactions and particle accelerators on exascale supercomputers.

detailed_description: HPK (High Performance Kubernetes) allows users to run Kubernetes-native applications within HPC environments by translating deployments to Slurm jobs and Singularity/Apptainer containers, bridging cloud-native and HPC workflows.

name: cotainr

detailed_description: A tool designed to build Apptainer/Singularity containers in user space, facilitating the deployment of scientific software in HPC environments.

name: E4S

detailed_description: The Extreme-scale Scientific Software Stack (E4S) project repository for Spack integration, providing a curated collection of open-source software packages for HPC.

name: E4S  la carte

detailed_description: A tool that allows users to customize container images by adding system and Spack packages, tailored for the Extreme-scale Scientific Software Stack (E4S).

name: E4S Container Launcher

detailed_description: A tool to manage and launch containers for the E4S project, simplifying the use of containerized scientific applications on HPC systems.

name: CarpetX

name: pyfra

name: AMR-Wind

name: cuFSDAF

name: CompGrids.jl

detailed_description: A Julia library for creating computational grids compatible with ParallelStencil.jl and PETSc.jl, facilitating numerical simulations.

name: PETSc.jl
one_line_profile: Julia wrappers for the PETSc scientific library
detailed_description: The Julia interface to PETSc (Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation), enabling high-performance scientific computing within the Julia ecosystem.

name: uberenv
one_line_profile: Automated Spack-based software deployment tool
detailed_description: A tool developed by LLNL to automate the use of Spack for building and deploying complex scientific software stacks.

name: Mallard
one_line_profile: Unstructured, GPU accelerated, high-order finite volume CFD solver
detailed_description: Mallard is a high-order finite volume Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver designed for unstructured grids. It leverages GPU acceleration to perform efficient simulations of fluid flows.

name: ngmo-environments
one_line_profile: Configuration environments for Met Office's Next Generation Modelling
detailed_description: This repository contains the environment definitions and configurations required for the Next Generation Modelling for Momentum (NG-Mom) project at the Met Office, likely utilizing Spack or container technologies for reproducibility.

name: strugepic
one_line_profile: Structure preserving symplectic PIC simulation code
detailed_description: Strugepic is a Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulation code that implements structure-preserving symplectic algorithms. It is built upon the AMReX framework for adaptive mesh refinement and parallel computing.

name: molssi-hub
one_line_profile: Container Hub for Computational Molecular Science
detailed_description: The MolSSI Container Hub provides a centralized repository and tools for accessing and managing containers for computational molecular science software, facilitating reproducible research.

name: MHIT36
one_line_profile: Multi-GPU code for interface-resolved multiphase turbulence simulations
detailed_description: MHIT36 is a Direct Numerical Simulation (DNS) code for multiphase turbulence. It uses a phase-field method for interface description and is optimized for multi-GPU execution using the cuDecomp library.

name: ngs-petsc
one_line_profile: Interface between NGSolve and PETSc
detailed_description: ngs-petsc is a library that provides an interface between the NGSolve finite element library and the PETSc toolkit for scientific computation, enabling the use of PETSc solvers within NGSolve.

name: SimpleTCSolver
one_line_profile: Massively-parallelized solver for Taylor-Couette flows
detailed_description: SimpleTCSolver is a specialized Navier-Stokes solver optimized for simulating Taylor-Couette flows in a massively parallel computing environment.

name: SimpleVOFSolver
one_line_profile: Massively-parallelized VOF solver for droplet-laden flows
detailed_description: SimpleVOFSolver implements the Volume-of-Fluid (VOF) method within a Navier-Stokes solver to simulate droplet-laden flows on massively parallel systems.

name: nekRS
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated spectral element CFD solver
detailed_description: nekRS is the next-generation version of Nek5000, designed from the ground up for GPU acceleration using OCCA. It retains the spectral element method's accuracy while leveraging modern heterogeneous architectures.

name: NekBox
one_line_profile: Box-geometry prototyping version of Nek5000
detailed_description: NekBox is a specialized version of the Nek5000 code focused on box geometries. It serves as a prototyping tool for testing new algorithms and features in a simplified geometric context.

name: CFD-and-Blood-Damage-Benchmarks
one_line_profile: Benchmark data for CFD and blood damage validation
detailed_description: This repository contains benchmark datasets and validation studies for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) applied to blood damage modeling, sponsored by the FDA.

name: OpenCFD-SCU
one_line_profile: GPU High precision finite difference CFD solver
detailed_description: OpenCFD-SCU is a high-precision finite difference CFD solver optimized for GPU architectures, developed for efficient simulation of fluid flows.

name: phasta
one_line_profile: Parallel Hierarchic Adaptive Stabilized Transient Analysis solver
detailed_description: PHASTA is a parallel, adaptive, stabilized finite element flow solver for compressible and incompressible Navier-Stokes equations, suitable for transient analysis.

name: LBDEMcoupling-public
one_line_profile: Coupling between Palabos (LBM) and LIGGGHTS (DEM)
detailed_description: This tool provides a coupling interface between the Lattice-Boltzmann code Palabos and the Discrete Element Method code LIGGGHTS, enabling resolved simulations of particulate flows.

name: Palabos-PFM
one_line_profile: Palabos with Phase Field Method addons
detailed_description: Palabos-PFM extends the Palabos Lattice Boltzmann solver with Phase Field Method (PFM) capabilities for simulating multiphase flows with interface tracking.

name: pawsey-spack-config
one_line_profile: Spack configuration for Pawsey Supercomputing Centre
detailed_description: This repository contains the Spack configuration files and recipes used to deploy the scientific software stack at the Pawsey Supercomputing Centre, facilitating reproducible HPC environments.

name: pressio-rom
one_line_profile: Library for reduced order models and solvers
detailed_description: pressio-rom is a library providing linear and non-linear solvers, time integration schemes, and infrastructure for building Reduced Order Models (ROMs) in scientific computing.

name: rocm-spack-pkgs
one_line_profile: Spack recipes for ROCm software stack
detailed_description: This repository hosts Spack package recipes for the ROCm (Radeon Open Compute) platform, enabling the deployment of AMD's HPC software stack via the Spack package manager.

name: Neurodocker
one_line_profile: Container generator for reproducible neuroimaging and scientific computing
detailed_description: A command-line tool to generate custom Docker and Singularity/Apptainer recipes and images for neuroimaging and scientific research, ensuring reproducibility by minimizing container size and managing dependencies.

name: Spackenv
one_line_profile: Environment management wrapper for Spack on HPC clusters
detailed_description: A tool developed by SJTU HPC to manage and switch between Spack environments for system administrators, users, and developers, facilitating software stack management on high-performance computing clusters.

name: SedFoam
one_line_profile: Two-phase flow solver for sediment transport in OpenFOAM
detailed_description: A specialized solver for the OpenFOAM toolbox designed to simulate two-phase flow and sediment transport, widely used in geophysical and engineering fluid dynamics.

name: SmartFlow
one_line_profile: Deep reinforcement learning framework for CFD on HPC
detailed_description: A CFD-solver-agnostic deep reinforcement learning framework designed for high-performance computing platforms, facilitating the application of AI control and optimization in fluid dynamics simulations.

name: Tramonto
one_line_profile: DFT-based software for modeling nanostructured fluids
detailed_description: A software package from Sandia National Laboratories for modeling nanostructured fluids using Density Functional Theories (DFT) and Trilinos solvers, applicable to materials science and chemical physics.

name: E4S Recipes
one_line_profile: Spack environments and container recipes for E4S
detailed_description: A collection of Spack environment configurations and container recipes for the Extreme-scale Scientific Software Stack (E4S), facilitating the deployment of scientific software on HPC systems.

name: AI-workflows
one_line_profile: Portable AI workflows for benchmarking
detailed_description: A collection of portable, real-world AI workflows developed by the Alan Turing Institute for testing and benchmarking AI infrastructure and scientific applications.

name: PyFRAP
one_line_profile: FRAP analysis toolbox
detailed_description: A Python-based toolbox for the analysis of Fluorescence Recovery After Photobleaching (FRAP) data, used to estimate diffusion coefficients and binding kinetics in biophysics.

name: Alsvinn
one_line_profile: Fast Finite Volume simulator with UQ support
detailed_description: A high-performance Finite Volume simulator designed for solving conservation laws with built-in support for Uncertainty Quantification (UQ), utilizing GPU acceleration.

name: Apptainer
one_line_profile: Application container system for HPC (formerly Singularity)
detailed_description: The open-source container system for High-Performance Computing (HPC), formerly known as Singularity, designed to execute applications at bare-metal performance while maintaining security and reproducibility.

name: Apptheus
one_line_profile: Prometheus metrics agent for Apptainer
detailed_description: A monitoring agent that exposes Apptainer container metrics to Prometheus, enabling observability of containerized workloads in HPC environments.

name: Singularity
one_line_profile: Legacy repository for Singularity containers
detailed_description: The historical repository for Singularity (now Apptainer), widely used for scientific containers in HPC. This repo serves as a snapshot before the project moved to the Linux Foundation.

name: tbslas
one_line_profile: Parallel semi-Lagrangian advection-diffusion solver
detailed_description: A parallel, fast solver for scalar advection-diffusion and incompressible Navier-Stokes equations based on semi-Lagrangian and Volume-Integral methods, designed for high-performance simulation.

name: THAPI-spack
one_line_profile: Spack environment for THAPI tracing tool
detailed_description: A Spack environment configuration for THAPI (Tracing High Performance Applications), facilitating the deployment of tracing and profiling tools on HPC systems.

name: qc-pyFramework
one_line_profile: ASAM standards quality checker framework
detailed_description: A quality checker framework developed by ASAM e.V. to validate file and implementation conformity against ASAM automotive and engineering standards.

name: AmgXWrapper
one_line_profile: Interface between PETSc and NVIDIA AmgX library for GPU acceleration
detailed_description: A middleware library that allows PETSc-based scientific applications to utilize NVIDIA's AmgX library for solving linear systems on GPUs.

name: PetIBM
one_line_profile: Immersed-boundary method solver for distributed-memory architectures
detailed_description: A toolbox and application suite for solving the Navier-Stokes equations using the immersed-boundary method, designed for high-performance computing clusters.

name: apptainer-conda
one_line_profile: Tool for managing local Conda environments within Apptainer containers
detailed_description: A utility to facilitate the creation and usage of Conda environments inside Apptainer (Singularity) containers, streamlining scientific workflows on HPC systems.

name: PFEMFort
one_line_profile: Parallel programming framework for Finite Element Analysis
detailed_description: A framework for developing parallel Finite Element Analysis (FEA) applications using Fortran and PETSc.

name: PyClaw
one_line_profile: Python interface to Clawpack and SharpClaw algorithms
detailed_description: A Python-based interface for the Clawpack library, providing solvers for hyperbolic partial differential equations with support for parallel execution via PETSc (PetClaw).

name: CompareM2
one_line_profile: Microbial genomes-to-report pipeline
detailed_description: A comprehensive pipeline for comparative genomics of microbial organisms, generating reports from genomic data.

name: mrs_apptainer
one_line_profile: Apptainer wrappers and resources for MRS UAV System
detailed_description: A collection of Apptainer definitions and wrapper scripts to deploy and run the MRS UAV System for robotics research and simulation.

name: PetIGA
one_line_profile: PETSc-based framework for isogeometric analysis
detailed_description: A framework built on top of PETSc for solving Partial Differential Equations using Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) methods.

name: channel
one_line_profile: DNS solver for turbulent channel flow
detailed_description: A Direct Numerical Simulation (DNS) code for incompressible turbulent channel flow, featuring two-dimensional parallelization.

name: MaximumSize_on_TopOpt_in_PETSc
one_line_profile: Maximum Size constraints implementation for Topology Optimization in PETSc
detailed_description: An implementation of maximum size constraints within a topology optimization framework based on PETSc, useful for structural optimization.

name: ERF
one_line_profile: Energy Research and Forecasting Model for atmospheric simulation
detailed_description: ERF is a compressible Navier-Stokes solver built on the AMReX framework, designed for atmospheric modeling and energy research.

name: NeoN
one_line_profile: Modern CFD core prototype for high-order methods
detailed_description: NeoN is a work-in-progress prototype for a modern Computational Fluid Dynamics core, focusing on high-order numerical methods.

name: dolfiny
one_line_profile: High-level wrappers for DOLFINx (FEniCS)
detailed_description: dolfiny provides high-level convenience wrappers and utilities for DOLFINx, facilitating finite element simulations within the FEniCS ecosystem.

name: SkellySim
one_line_profile: Hydrodynamic Cytoskeleton Simulator for bio-fluids
detailed_description: SkellySim is a simulation tool for hydrodynamic cytoskeletal systems, modeling the interaction of flexible fibers and fluids.

name: relexi
one_line_profile: Reinforcement learning framework for CFD on HPC
detailed_description: Relexi is a scalable framework designed to apply reinforcement learning algorithms to Computational Fluid Dynamics problems on High-Performance Computing systems.

name: MANDYOC
one_line_profile: Finite element code for mantle convection simulation
detailed_description: MANDYOC is a finite element code built on PETSc to simulate thermo-chemical convection of the Earth's mantle.

name: OpenSayal
one_line_profile: Real-time GPU accelerated fluid simulator
detailed_description: OpenSayal is a fluid simulation tool leveraging GPU acceleration for real-time performance.

name: GridapPETSc.jl
one_line_profile: PETSc solvers interface for Gridap.jl
detailed_description: GridapPETSc.jl provides an interface to use PETSc scalable solvers within the Gridap Julia finite element framework.

name: HPDDM
one_line_profile: High-performance domain decomposition methods framework
detailed_description: HPDDM is a framework providing high-performance implementations of domain decomposition methods for solving large-scale linear systems.

name: petsc4foam
one_line_profile: PETSc linear solvers for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: petsc4foam integrates PETSc's high-performance linear solvers into the OpenFOAM framework to accelerate simulations.

name: GustGrid
one_line_profile: Real-time CUDA-powered airflow and thermal simulation tool
detailed_description: A C++/OpenGL tool utilizing CUDA for real-time simulation of airflow and thermal dynamics in PC cases, enabling interactive visualization of fluid dynamics.

name: apptainer-in-docker
one_line_profile: Utility to run Apptainer (HPC containers) inside Docker
detailed_description: A specialized infrastructure tool enabling the use of Apptainer (formerly Singularity), the standard HPC container runtime, within Docker environments, facilitating CI/CD for scientific workflows.

name: Peridigm
one_line_profile: Massively-parallel computational peridynamics code
detailed_description: An open-source computational peridynamics code developed at Sandia National Laboratories for multi-physics simulations of material failure, built on Trilinos.

name: madupite
one_line_profile: Distributed Solver for Large-Scale Markov Decision Processes
detailed_description: A high-performance distributed solver for large-scale Markov Decision Processes (MDP) utilizing inexact policy iteration, applicable in operations research and control theory.

name: pi-BEM
one_line_profile: Parallel Boundary Element Method solver
detailed_description: A parallel implementation of the Boundary Element Method (BEM) for solving partial differential equations, developed by SISSA mathLab.

name: Syndeo
one_line_profile: Tool to run Ray jobs on SLURM with Apptainer
detailed_description: A workflow orchestration tool from MIT Lincoln Laboratory that enables running massively parallel Ray jobs on SLURM clusters using secure Apptainer containers.

name: aither
one_line_profile: 3D block-structured Navier-Stokes solver
detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics solver for the Navier-Stokes equations, featuring 3D block-structured grids and explicit/implicit time stepping.

name: PETSc-FEM
one_line_profile: General purpose parallel multi-physics finite element solver
detailed_description: A general purpose, parallel, multi-physics finite element program developed at CIMEC, built on top of PETSc libraries for solving partial differential equations.

name: nekStab
one_line_profile: Global linear stability analysis toolbox for Nek5000
detailed_description: An open source toolbox based on Krylov methods for performing highly parallel global linear stability analysis of incompressible flow problems within the Nek5000 CFD framework.

name: BARAM
one_line_profile: User-friendly CFD software package based on OpenFOAM
detailed_description: A comprehensive CFD software package designed to be accessible ('CFD for Everyone'), providing a GUI and workflow management for OpenFOAM-based simulations.

name: freeCappuccino
one_line_profile: 3D unstructured finite volume CFD solver
detailed_description: A three-dimensional unstructured finite volume code designed for fluid flow simulations, supporting various mesh types and flow conditions.

name: petsc-hs
one_line_profile: Haskell bindings for PETSc and SLEPc
detailed_description: Provides Haskell bindings for the PETSc and SLEPc scientific computing libraries, enabling high-performance linear algebra and PDE solving within the Haskell ecosystem.

name: OpenMPS
one_line_profile: Moving Particle Semi-implicit (MPS) method implementation
detailed_description: An open source implementation of the Moving Particle Semi-implicit (MPS) method, a meshless method for simulating free-surface fluid flows.

name: DOT
one_line_profile: Decomposed Optimization Time Integration for deformation dynamics
detailed_description: A domain-decomposed optimization method (DOT) for fast and reliable simulation of deformation dynamics, enabling efficient convergence in extreme conditions.

name: PERMON
one_line_profile: Parallel quadratic programming solver package
detailed_description: A main package for quadratic programming (PermonQP) within the PERMON toolbox, providing parallel, scalable numerical solvers often used in contact mechanics and SVMs.

name: PETSc
one_line_profile: Portable Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation
detailed_description: A suite of data structures and routines for the scalable (parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial differential equations, widely used in CFD and physics simulations.

name: PISM
one_line_profile: Parallel Ice Sheet Model
detailed_description: An open source, parallel, high-resolution ice sheet model designed for simulating the dynamics of ice sheets and glaciers.

name: ramsesGPU
one_line_profile: GPU-optimized Astrophysics MHD simulation code
detailed_description: A version of the RAMSES astrophysics Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulation code optimized for large clusters of GPUs.

name: preCICE SU2 Adapter
one_line_profile: Coupling adapter connecting the SU2 CFD solver with the preCICE coupling library
detailed_description: An official adapter that allows the SU2 CFD solver to communicate with the preCICE coupling library, enabling partitioned multi-physics simulations such as fluid-structure interaction (FSI) or conjugate heat transfer (CHT).

name: AlphaFold Singularity

detailed_description: A Singularity/Apptainer recipe designed to build and deploy the AlphaFold protein structure prediction system in High Performance Computing (HPC) environments where Docker is not available.

name: Quokka
one_line_profile: Two-moment AMR radiation hydrodynamics solver for astrophysics
detailed_description: A high-performance radiation hydrodynamics code with adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) that runs on CPUs and GPUs, designed for astrophysical simulations involving self-gravity, particles, and magnetic fields.

name: EBGeometry
one_line_profile: C++ library for embedded boundary (EB) geometry generation
detailed_description: A package for generating embedded boundary geometries, useful for setting up complex domains in CFD and PDE simulations.

name: PolyMPS
one_line_profile: Moving Particle Semi-implicit (MPS) method solver
detailed_description: A C++/OpenMP implementation of the Moving Particle Semi-implicit (MPS) method for simulating free-surface fluid flows with polygon or particle walls.

name: Spack Manager
one_line_profile: Management tool for Spack-based project and machine deployments
detailed_description: A tool developed by Sandia National Laboratories to manage complex Spack environments, facilitating the deployment of scientific software stacks on HPC machines.

name: P3DFFT++
one_line_profile: Parallel 3D Fast Fourier Transform library for multiscale simulations
detailed_description: A comprehensive library for performing parallel 3D FFTs, designed as a framework for simulating multiscale phenomena in HPC environments, supporting 1D/2D/3D domain decomposition.

name: REMORA
one_line_profile: GPU-enabled version of the Regional Ocean Modeling System (ROMS)
detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated implementation of the ROMS ocean model, developed under the SciDAC project to enable high-performance oceanographic simulations.

name: Wave CLI
one_line_profile: CLI tool for provisioning containers in scientific workflows
detailed_description: The command-line interface for the Wave container service, used within the Nextflow ecosystem to provision and manage containers for reproducible scientific data pipelines.

name: cudaParticlesFoam
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated particle tracking library for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: A library that offloads Lagrangian particle tracking calculations to the GPU within the OpenFOAM CFD framework, accelerating multiphase flow simulations.

name: docker2singularity

detailed_description: A utility that facilitates the conversion of Docker container images into Singularity images, enabling the use of Docker-based scientific tools in HPC environments where Singularity is the standard.

name: Alamo
one_line_profile: Solid mechanics solver with Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR)
detailed_description: A C++ code providing explicit and implicit solvers for solid mechanics problems, utilizing adaptive mesh refinement to handle multiscale features efficiently.

name: Spack
one_line_profile: Flexible package manager for HPC software
detailed_description: A multi-platform package manager designed for high-performance computing (HPC) that supports multiple versions, configurations, platforms, and compilers, essential for managing scientific software stacks.

name: SPECTER

name: TopOpt in PETSc Python

name: TopOpt in PETSc

name: TopOpt in PETSc Transient

name: ForTrilinos

name: Trilinos

name: JAXFLUIDS

name: Underworld2

detailed_description: A parallel, particle-in-cell, finite element code designed for large-scale geodynamics simulations and modelling of crustal and mantle dynamics.

name: Waiwera

name: TopADD

name: navier_stokes_multigrid

detailed_description: EDGE (Extreme-scale Discontinuous Galerkin Environment) is a solver environment designed for high-performance solving of partial differential equations using the Discontinuous Galerkin method.

name: fedoo

detailed_description: A finite element library implemented in Python, designed for solving physical problems using the Finite Element Method (FEM).

name: 4C

detailed_description: 4C is a comprehensive multiphysics simulation framework designed to handle complex coupled physical phenomena.

name: GalerkinSparseGrids.jl

detailed_description: A Julia library implementing Sparse Grid Discretization with the Discontinuous Galerkin Method for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs).

name: DNSLABIB

name: AIDAmri

name: ASL

name: CalculiX

name: pyleecan

detailed_description: An implementation of the Delaunay triangulation algorithm that supports constrained edges, useful for mesh generation and computational geometry tasks.

name: Netgen LVS
one_line_profile: Layout vs Schematic (LVS) verification tool for VLSI
detailed_description: A tool for comparing netlists (e.g., SPICE vs Verilog), primarily used in Electronic Design Automation (EDA) for Layout vs Schematic verification. (Note: Distinct from the Netgen Mesher).

name: DelaunayVoronoi
one_line_profile: Delaunay triangulation and Voronoi diagram library in C#
detailed_description: A C# implementation of the BowyerWatson algorithm for generating Delaunay triangulations and Voronoi diagrams, suitable for 2D mesh generation.

name: SLIDE
one_line_profile: Controllable point cloud and mesh generation model
detailed_description: A deep learning framework for generating controllable 3D point clouds and meshes, enabling text-driven or parameter-driven 3D content creation.

name: ADHMR
one_line_profile: Diffusion-based human mesh recovery model
detailed_description: An AI model for recovering human meshes from images using diffusion models aligned via Direct Preference Optimization (DPO).

name: Constrained_Delaunay_Triangulation
one_line_profile: C# implementation of Constrained Delaunay Triangulation (CDT) for surface domains
detailed_description: A C# library that implements the Constrained Delaunay Triangulation algorithm, allowing for the generation of triangular meshes on surface domains with specific constraints. Useful for computational geometry and mesh generation tasks.

name: PaMO
one_line_profile: Parallel Mesh Optimization for Intersection-Free Low-Poly Modeling on the GPU
detailed_description: The official implementation of the PG2025 paper 'PaMO'. It provides a GPU-accelerated tool for optimizing meshes to be intersection-free, specifically targeting low-poly modeling scenarios in geometry processing.

name: Salome_Plugins
one_line_profile: Collection of scripts and plugins for the Salome FEA/CFD platform
detailed_description: A set of Python scripts and plugins designed to extend the functionality of the Salome platform, which is widely used for pre-processing (meshing) and post-processing in numerical simulations (FEA/CFD).

name: CGALDotNet
one_line_profile: C# wrapper for the Computational Geometry Algorithms Library (CGAL)
detailed_description: A C# wrapper for CGAL, one of the most comprehensive libraries for computational geometry. It enables .NET developers to access CGAL's robust algorithms for triangulation, voronoi diagrams, and mesh processing.

name: meshletmaker
one_line_profile: Collection of algorithms for generating meshlets from 3D meshes
detailed_description: A C++ library implementing algorithms to decompose 3D meshes into meshlets (small clusters of triangles). While often used for rendering, this geometry processing task is relevant for mesh optimization and parallel processing in simulations.

name: DPO Cook
one_line_profile: 3D Model, Geometry, and Texture Processing Server
detailed_description: Developed by the Smithsonian Digitization Program Office, this tool acts as a processing server for 3D data. It handles geometry processing, texture management, and file conversion, facilitating the pipeline for scientific and cultural heritage 3D digitization.

name: Assimp.Net
one_line_profile: .NET wrapper for the Open Asset Import Library (Assimp)
detailed_description: A C# wrapper for Assimp, a standard library for importing and exporting various 3D model formats. It is essential for pre-processing pipelines that need to handle diverse geometry data formats in scientific visualization or simulation tools.

name: spade
one_line_profile: Delaunay Triangulation library for Rust
detailed_description: A robust Rust library for performing Delaunay triangulations and related geometric operations. It serves as a foundational tool for mesh generation and computational geometry in the Rust ecosystem.

name: PySetVoronoi
one_line_profile: Python interface for Set Voronoi Tessellation
detailed_description: A tool that provides a Python interface to C++ implementations for computing Set Voronoi Tessellations. This is a specific geometric partitioning method useful in material science and granular mechanics.

name: bpt
one_line_profile: Scaling Mesh Generation via Compressive Tokenization
detailed_description: Official implementation of the CVPR'25 paper. It is an AI-based tool for efficient and scalable 3D mesh generation using compressive tokenization techniques, relevant for AI4S geometry reconstruction tasks.

name: InstantMesh
one_line_profile: Efficient 3D Mesh Generation from a Single Image
detailed_description: A state-of-the-art AI tool for generating high-quality 3D meshes from single images using sparse-view large reconstruction models. It automates the geometry creation process for scientific visualization and modeling.

name: OpenLane
one_line_profile: Automated RTL to GDSII flow for ASIC design
detailed_description: An automated flow for digital ASIC implementation. While primarily for chip design (EDA), it integrates multiple scientific solvers (OpenROAD, Yosys) for physical simulation, optimization, and layout, serving as a critical engineering research tool.

name: AtlasNet
one_line_profile: Learning 3D Surface Generation from point clouds or images
detailed_description: A deep learning framework for generating 3D surfaces (meshes) from low-resolution point clouds or images. It uses a patch-based approach to reconstruct high-quality geometry, useful for scientific data reconstruction.

name: sdf_tools
one_line_profile: Tools for building and manipulating Signed Distance Fields (SDFs)
detailed_description: A library for creating and compressing Signed Distance Fields (SDFs) from various inputs like images, point clouds, and Octomaps. SDFs are critical for collision checking, path planning, and physics simulations.

name: SdfLib
one_line_profile: Library for accelerating Signed Distance Field queries from triangle meshes
detailed_description: A C++ library designed to compute and query Signed Distance Fields (SDFs) from triangle meshes efficiently. It is useful for applications requiring fast distance computations in geometry processing and simulation.

name: Voxfield
one_line_profile: Non-Projective Signed Distance Fields for Online Planning and Reconstruction
detailed_description: A framework for building Signed Distance Fields (SDFs) suitable for online planning and 3D reconstruction. It addresses limitations of projective SDFs, making it valuable for robotics and dynamic environment modeling.

detailed_description: A collection of Abaqus UMAT subroutines and INP files implementing unified elasto-viscoplastic constitutive models specifically calibrated for 316 stainless steel and Zircaloy-4 materials.

detailed_description: A tool for performing Bloch wave analysis to calculate band gaps in mechanical metamaterials. It handles material and geometric nonlinearities and implements complex-valued boundary conditions within commercial FEA software.

detailed_description: A C# wrapper that exposes the Computational Geometry Algorithms Library (CGAL) functionalities to the Grasshopper visual programming environment, enabling advanced scientific geometry processing in CAD workflows.

name: MeshMosaic

detailed_description: Official implementation of the MeshMosaic paper, providing a method to generate large-scale 3D meshes by assembling local geometries, aimed at automating and scaling 3D content creation.

name: SDFDiff

detailed_description: A differentiable rendering framework that operates on Signed Distance Fields (SDF), enabling gradient-based 3D shape optimization and reconstruction from images.

name: delaunator-cpp

detailed_description: A high-performance C++ library for computing 2D Delaunay triangulations of point sets, widely used in computational geometry and meshing applications.

name: NN_aniso_UMAT

detailed_description: A framework implementing neural network-based hyperelastic constitutive models for anisotropic materials, including Abaqus UMAT subroutines for finite element analysis.
