detailed_description: A C++ implementation of ADMM (Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers) and Projective Dynamics for the fast simulation of general constitutive models in physics-based animation and mechanics.

name: ugscnn
one_line_profile: Spherical CNNs on Unstructured Grids
detailed_description: A library implementing Spherical CNNs on unstructured grids using parameterized differential operators. It is designed for deep learning on geometric data, such as spherical meshes used in climate modeling or physics.

name: ANNElastoplasticity
one_line_profile: Neural Network Approach for Elastoplastic Constitutive Modeling
detailed_description: A Python implementation utilizing neural networks to model elastoplastic constitutive behavior of materials. It serves as a tool for data-driven material modeling in mechanics.

name: dmsh
one_line_profile: Simple mesh generator inspired by distmesh
detailed_description: A Python mesh generator inspired by DistMesh, capable of generating high-quality triangular meshes for 2D geometries. It is useful for finite element analysis pre-processing.

name: pygalmesh
one_line_profile: Python interface to CGAL's meshing tools
detailed_description: A Python interface to the 3D mesh generation capabilities of the CGAL library. It allows for the generation of high-quality 3D meshes from various geometry descriptions, suitable for finite element analysis.

name: mfem
one_line_profile: Lightweight, general, scalable C++ library for finite element methods
detailed_description: MFEM is a modular parallel C++ library for finite element methods. It features arbitrary high-order finite element meshes and spaces, support for a wide variety of discretization methods, and scalable parallel performance.

name: ccvt
one_line_profile: Capacity-Constrained Voronoi Tessellations
detailed_description: A C++ implementation for generating Capacity-Constrained Voronoi Tessellations (CCVT). This technique is used for generating uniform meshes and sampling distributions in computational geometry and simulation.

name: Deformation-Transfer-for-Triangle-Meshes
one_line_profile: Implementation of Deformation Transfer for Triangle Meshes
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the 'Deformation Transfer for Triangle Meshes' algorithm. It allows transferring the deformation of a source mesh to a target mesh, useful in geometry processing and biomechanical modeling.

name: trimesh
one_line_profile: Python library for loading and using triangular meshes
detailed_description: A pure Python library for loading, processing, and analyzing triangular meshes. It supports a wide range of file formats and provides tools for geometry processing, collision detection, and simple physics, widely used in scientific workflows.

name: cdt2d
one_line_profile: 2D constrained Delaunay triangulation library
detailed_description: A robust JavaScript library for 2D constrained Delaunay triangulation. It is a fundamental computational geometry tool used in mesh generation and scientific visualization on the web.

name: delaunay-triangulate
one_line_profile: Robust Delaunay triangulation for n-dimensions
detailed_description: A library for performing robust Delaunay triangulation in arbitrary dimensions. It serves as a core component for mesh generation and spatial analysis in scientific computing contexts.

name: refine-mesh
one_line_profile: Iterative mesh refinement tool
detailed_description: A library for iterative mesh refinement, allowing for the improvement of mesh resolution and quality. This is essential in adaptive finite element analysis and geometry processing.

name: im2mesh
one_line_profile: MATLAB package for generating finite element meshes from 2D segmented images
detailed_description: A MATLAB/Octave package designed to generate finite element meshes based on 2D segmented multi-phase images, facilitating image-based simulation workflows.

name: jaxgptoolbox
one_line_profile: Geometry processing utilities compatible with JAX for autodifferentiation
detailed_description: A library providing geometry processing utilities that are compatible with JAX, enabling autodifferentiation for tasks involving 3D geometry and physics-based learning.

name: fem

detailed_description: A collection of Python tools for Finite Element Modeling (FEM), including interfaces for LS-DYNA pre/post-processing and intensity field solutions.

name: omni-tetGen
one_line_profile: NVIDIA Omniverse extension for generating soft body meshes
detailed_description: An extension for the NVIDIA Omniverse platform that integrates TetGen to generate tetrahedral meshes suitable for soft body simulations.

name: delaunator-rs
one_line_profile: Fast 2D Delaunay triangulation library in Rust
detailed_description: A Rust port of the Delaunator library, providing fast and robust 2D Delaunay triangulation algorithms suitable for mesh generation and computational geometry tasks.

name: delabella
one_line_profile: Robust 2D Delaunay triangulation library
detailed_description: A C++ library for 2D Delaunay triangulation focused on stability and robustness, suitable for mesh generation in scientific computing.

name: sdfperf

detailed_description: A node-based editor tool for experimenting with Signed Distance Fields (SDF) and raymarching, useful for procedural geometry modeling and visualization.

name: mesh_tools

detailed_description: A collection of tools and ROS messages for working with annotated 3D triangle meshes, facilitating geometry processing in robotics and simulation environments.

detailed_description: Official implementation of CaPa (Carve-n-Paint Synthesis), an AI tool for generating high-quality textured 3D meshes, applicable in generative design and simulation.

name: neper

detailed_description: A software package for the generation and meshing of polycrystals, widely used in materials science for finite element analysis of microstructure.

name: bleiglas

detailed_description: A tool for 3D tessellation-based interpolation and visualization, primarily designed for archaeological or geospatial spatiotemporal data analysis.

detailed_description: A C++ library implementing a robust construction of the Laplace matrix for general triangle meshes (including non-manifold) and point clouds, essential for geometry processing and physics simulation.

name: delaunator-sharp

detailed_description: A high-performance C# implementation of 2D Delaunay triangulation, suitable for mesh generation and computational geometry tasks.

name: signed-heat-3d

detailed_description: A C++ library implementing the Signed Heat Method to compute robust signed distance fields (SDFs) for 3D geometry, useful in simulation and geometry processing.

name: oceantracker

name: plexus

detailed_description: A Rust library for generating, manipulating, and processing polygonal meshes, providing data structures and algorithms for geometry processing.

name: poly2tri.js

detailed_description: A lightweight, single-header C library implementing 2D Constrained Delaunay Triangulation, essential for mesh generation and computational geometry tasks.

name: PARAVT

detailed_description: A C library for generating Voronoi tessellations in parallel, useful for domain decomposition and mesh generation in high-performance computing contexts.

name: CGAL.jl

detailed_description: A Julia wrapper for CGAL, providing access to robust geometric algorithms including triangulation, Voronoi diagrams, and mesh generation for scientific computing.

detailed_description: A Python library designed to calculate and analyze elastic properties of materials, supporting material modeling tasks in physics and engineering.

detailed_description: A C++ toolkit for visual computing with a strong focus on geometry processing algorithms, suitable for scientific modeling and simulation tasks.

name: Euclid

detailed_description: A library for mobile robot localization that works directly with 3D triangle meshes and geometric scene graphs. It utilizes ray tracing (via Embree or OptiX) to simulate sensor readings and match them against the mesh environment, bridging robotics and geometric simulation.

It provides a comprehensive environment for signal processing, image analysis, and general data manipulation, supporting various file formats and offering an extensible plugin system.

VTK is a standard library for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and visualization in scientific computing.

detailed_description: A library extension for training Fourier Neural Operators (FNO) in a distributed manner, enabling scaling to larger models and datasets.

name: TensorDiffEq
one_line_profile: Scalable Physics-Informed Deep Learning library on TensorFlow
detailed_description: An efficient and scalable library for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and scientific machine learning built on top of TensorFlow, supporting multi-worker distributed computing.

name: mystic
one_line_profile: Constrained nonlinear optimization framework for scientific machine learning and UQ
detailed_description: Mystic is a robust framework for high-dimensional constrained nonlinear optimization. It is widely used in scientific machine learning for inverse problems, parameter estimation, and uncertainty quantification (UQ), offering capabilities to handle complex constraints and penalty functions.

name: Rowdy Activation Functions
one_line_profile: Adaptive activation functions library for Deep Kronecker Neural Networks in PDE solving
detailed_description: A library implementing Rowdy activation functions designed to inject sinusoidal fluctuations, helping optimizers exploit search spaces better in Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and other deep learning tasks.

name: CEED Benchmarks
one_line_profile: High-order finite element benchmarks for exascale computing
detailed_description: A suite of benchmarks designed to test and evaluate the performance of high-order finite element algorithms on modern hardware architectures, developed by the Center for Efficient Exascale Discretizations (CEED).

name: StiffNet Benchmark
one_line_profile: Benchmark for learning stiff PDE problems using physics-informed machine learning
detailed_description: A benchmark suite specifically designed to evaluate the performance of Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and other scientific machine learning models on stiff differential equations.

name: PyFREC
one_line_profile: Excitation energy transfer modeling software
detailed_description: A software tool for modeling excitation energy transfer (EET) in molecular systems, useful for physical chemistry and biophysics simulations.

name: SPDEBench

detailed_description: An extensive benchmark dataset and framework for evaluating machine learning models on solving Stochastic Partial Differential Equations (SPDEs), covering both regular and singular cases.

name: opfgym

detailed_description: A framework providing reinforcement learning environments for solving Optimal Power Flow (OPF) problems in power systems, including standard benchmarks for comparable research.

name: CLT-material-properties

detailed_description: A Python tool for calculating Young's modulus, stiffness matrix, strength, and failure criteria for composite laminate materials (CLT).

name: BLOCKING

detailed_description: A set of tools for assessing the convergence of Molecular Dynamics (MD) simulations through error analysis of calculated ensemble averages and free energies.

name: Mamo

detailed_description: A benchmark dataset designed to evaluate the mathematical modeling capabilities of AI models, including problem formulation and solver integration.

name: AsterReader.jl

name: SolverBenchmark.jl

detailed_description: A Julia package providing utilities to benchmark and compare the performance of numerical optimization solvers.

name: OasisMove

name: mis-benchmark-framework

name: TRIQS Benchmarks

name: FlashAdventure

name: LAP-solvers

name: yet-another-applied-llm-benchmark

name: Nektar++ (Mirror)

name: MASA

It provides a repository of exact solutions for code verification in CFD and FEA.

name: PINNs

name: Parthenon
one_line_profile: Performance portable adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) framework
detailed_description: Parthenon is a high-performance, portable Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) framework derived from Athena++. It serves as an infrastructure for building grid-based simulation codes that can run on CPUs and GPUs using Kokkos.

name: GeoSlicer
one_line_profile: Platform for digital rocks physics and micro-CT image analysis
detailed_description: GeoSlicer is an open-source platform for digital rock physics, enabling analysis of micro-CT, CT, and borehole images. It includes tools for segmentation, porosity/permeability analysis, and flow simulation in porous media.

name: Phoebe
one_line_profile: Solver for phonon and electron Boltzmann transport equations
detailed_description: Phoebe is a high-performance C++ code for solving the Boltzmann transport equation for phonons and electrons. It is used to calculate transport properties like thermal conductivity and electron mobility in materials.

name: euler_kokkos
one_line_profile: Compressible hydro and MHD solver using MPI+Kokkos
detailed_description: A compressible hydrodynamics and magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) solver implementing 2nd order Godunov schemes. It utilizes MPI and Kokkos for parallel execution across CPUs and GPUs, serving as a robust research code for HPC methods.

name: ppkMHD
one_line_profile: MPI+Kokkos spectral difference method implementation
detailed_description: An implementation of high-order spectral difference methods (SDM) for magnetohydrodynamics (MHD), accelerated with MPI and Kokkos. It targets high-performance simulation on modern hardware architectures.

name: s-blas
one_line_profile: Sparse linear algebra kernels for multi-GPU scale-up platforms
detailed_description: A library implementing sparse linear algebra kernels (SpMV, SpTRSV, SpTrans, SpMM) optimized for single-node multi-GPU platforms like NVIDIA DGX, developed by PNNL.

name: polysolve
one_line_profile: Wrapper library for various linear and non-linear solvers
detailed_description: A C++ library that provides a unified interface to various linear and non-linear solvers, designed to be easy to use within finite element applications like PolyFEM.

name: fenicsx-adapter
one_line_profile: Adapter to couple FEniCSx solvers with preCICE
detailed_description: An adapter enabling the integration of FEniCSx-based solvers into partitioned multi-physics simulations managed by the preCICE coupling library.

name: PyAMG
one_line_profile: Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers in Python
detailed_description: A library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers for solving large sparse linear systems, commonly arising in solving partial differential equations.

name: sunode
one_line_profile: Fast ODE solver with PyMC support
detailed_description: A Python library for solving Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs) efficiently, with specific support for derivatives required by probabilistic programming in PyMC.

name: python-graphblas
one_line_profile: Python library for GraphBLAS sparse linear algebra
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the GraphBLAS standard, providing high-performance sparse linear algebra primitives often used in graph analytics and scientific computing.

name: trng4
one_line_profile: Parallel pseudo-random number generator library for Monte Carlo
detailed_description: A state-of-the-art C++ library for generating pseudo-random numbers, specifically designed for sequential and parallel Monte Carlo simulations.

name: raptor

detailed_description: A general-purpose, high-performance Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solver library written in C++.

name: PSBLAS
one_line_profile: Parallel Sparse Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms library
detailed_description: PSBLAS (Parallel Sparse Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) is a library that implements sparse linear algebra operations on distributed memory parallel computers. It provides a framework for iterative solvers and preconditioners, essential for large-scale scientific simulations.

name: SimGrid
one_line_profile: Framework for simulation of distributed computer systems (Cloud, HPC, Grid)
detailed_description: SimGrid is a scientific instrument for studying the behavior of large-scale distributed systems such as Grids, Clouds, HPC clusters, and Fog Computing. It allows researchers to simulate algorithms and applications to evaluate performance and correctness.

name: sprs
one_line_profile: Sparse linear algebra library for Rust
detailed_description: sprs is a library for sparse matrix computations in Rust. It provides data structures and algorithms for sparse linear algebra, which are fundamental for implementing scientific solvers and simulations in the Rust ecosystem.

name: SPARTA
one_line_profile: Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) code for rarefied gas dynamics
detailed_description: SPARTA is a parallel DSMC code for simulating low-density gases. It is designed to run efficiently on large-scale parallel computers and is used for modeling rarefied gas flows, such as spacecraft re-entry or vacuum systems.

name: SPH-EXA
one_line_profile: Parallel SPH (Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics) simulation code
detailed_description: SPH-EXA is a C++20 simulation framework for performing hydrodynamics simulations using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) method. It is optimized for modern HPC architectures, supporting MPI, OpenMP, CUDA, and HIP for massive parallelism.

name: SST Elements
one_line_profile: Component library for the Structural Simulation Toolkit (SST)
detailed_description: SST Elements provides a collection of simulation components (processors, memory, network) for the Structural Simulation Toolkit. It is used to simulate and evaluate the performance of future high-performance computing architectures.

name: Stan Math Library
one_line_profile: C++ template library for automatic differentiation and probabilistic modeling
detailed_description: The Stan Math Library provides robust, high-performance automatic differentiation (forward, reverse, and mixed modes) and a comprehensive set of mathematical functions. It is the computational engine behind the Stan probabilistic programming language, widely used for Bayesian inference and statistical modeling.

name: Sundial
one_line_profile: Foundation model for time series analysis
detailed_description: Sundial is a family of highly capable foundation models designed for time series analysis. It provides pre-trained models for tasks such as forecasting, classification, and anomaly detection across various scientific and industrial domains.

name: trotter-suzuki-mpi

detailed_description: A massively parallel implementation of the Trotter-Suzuki decomposition method for solving quantum spin systems and other matrix exponentiation problems.

name: quagmire

detailed_description: A Python framework for modeling surface processes (erosion, transport) on highly scalable unstructured meshes, part of the Underworld geodynamics ecosystem.

name: underworld2

detailed_description: A parallel, particle-in-cell, finite element code designed for large-scale geodynamics simulations, allowing for the modeling of complex fluid flows in the Earth's mantle and lithosphere.

name: vistle

detailed_description: A software environment designed for high-performance simulation and parallel visualization, supporting distributed data processing and rendering on HPC clusters.

name: waiwera

detailed_description: A parallel, open-source simulator for geothermal flow, heat transport, and solute transport in porous media, designed for geothermal reservoir modeling.

name: TopADD_2D_3D_Arbitrary_TopOpt_in_PETSc

detailed_description: A 2D/3D integrated topology optimization parallel-computing framework capable of handling arbitrary design domains using PETSc.

detailed_description: A library that enables in-situ analysis and visualization for simulations written in C/C++ by bridging them with the Python-based 'yt' analysis toolkit, allowing researchers to analyze data during simulation runtime.

name: zpc

detailed_description: An open-source Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) solver for electromagnetics, supporting 1D, 2D, and 3D simulations with parallel acceleration via MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA across multiple architectures.

detailed_description: Emu is a simulation code for neutrino quantum kinetics based on the particle-in-cell method, optimized for CPU and GPU supercomputing architectures within the AMReX framework.

detailed_description: A library for performing N-body gravity simulations, providing both C and Python APIs. It allows for setting up and running gravitational dynamics simulations.

name: pygran
one_line_profile: Toolkit for Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulation analysis
detailed_description: A Python toolkit for the rapid simulation and quantitative analysis of granular systems using the Discrete Element Method (DEM).

name: atomify
one_line_profile: Web-based real-time molecular dynamics visualization tool
detailed_description: A tool that enables real-time molecular dynamics simulations and visualization directly in the web browser, utilizing LAMMPS for the underlying physics engine.

name: pybbfmm

detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Black-box Fast Multipole Method, providing efficient algorithms for calculating long-range interactions in N-body problems and other physics simulations.

name: Halotools
one_line_profile: Python package for studying large scale structure and galaxy evolution using N-body simulations
detailed_description: Halotools is a specialized python package for building and testing models of the galaxy-halo connection, and analyzing catalogs of dark matter halos. It provides a modular platform for creating mock galaxy catalogs and analyzing them.

name: Occupancy Flow
one_line_profile: 4D Reconstruction method by learning particle dynamics
detailed_description: A deep learning approach for 4D reconstruction that represents the continuous vector field of 3D motion as a neural ordinary differential equation (ODE), enabling physically plausible dynamics inference.

name: KiFMM
one_line_profile: High-performance Fast Multipole Method (FMM) library in Rust
detailed_description: A modular and high-performance implementation of the Fast Multipole Method (FMM) written in Rust, designed for solving N-body problems and Helmholtz equations efficiently.

name: openPMD-resampler

detailed_description: A utility for processing and resampling data from Particle-in-Cell simulations that adhere to the openPMD standard, facilitating data analysis and visualization.

name: MDBenchmark
one_line_profile: Tool to generate, start, and analyze benchmarks for molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: A command-line tool and Python library designed to automate the benchmarking of molecular dynamics simulations (GROMACS, NAMD) on high-performance computing systems.

name: Rakau

name: demografr

detailed_description: A framework designed for performing simulation-based inference tasks within the field of evolutionary biology, enabling researchers to model and infer demographic histories.

name: OpenMM-Python-Force

detailed_description: An OpenMM plugin that allows users to define custom forces using Python code, enabling the integration of arbitrary potential energy functions or machine learning potentials into OpenMM simulations.

name: FastMultipole.jl
one_line_profile: Fast Multipole Method (FMM) implementation in Julia
detailed_description: A flexible and fast implementation of the Fast Multipole Method in Julia, supporting multi-kernel and multi-system configurations for efficient potential field calculations.

name: martinize.py

detailed_description: A script used to generate coarse-grained topology and coordinate files for the Martini force field from atomistic PDB structures, facilitating multiscale molecular dynamics simulations.

name: ai2-kit

name: openmmtools

name: Streamd

name: Pylians3

name: bhtsne

name: power-pic

name: t_sne_bhcuda

name: HOOMD-blue

name: grappa

name: GROMACS

name: cemfDEM
one_line_profile: Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulation code

name: Runko

detailed_description: A structure finder (Halo finder) for N-body and hydrodynamical simulations, capable of identifying galaxies, halos, and substructures in large cosmological datasets.

name: StellarSolver
one_line_profile: High-Performance N-Body Simulation with CUDA
detailed_description: A high-performance N-body simulation tool utilizing CUDA and the Barnes-Hut algorithm to solve gravitational many-body problems efficiently on GPUs.

name: lammps_interface
one_line_profile: Automatic generation of LAMMPS input files for MOFs
detailed_description: A Python tool to automatically generate LAMMPS input files for molecular dynamics simulations of Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs), handling force field assignment and topology generation.

name: PICMI
one_line_profile: Standard input format and library for Particle-In-Cell codes
detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Particle-In-Cell Modeling Interface (PICMI) standard, allowing users to define PIC simulations in a code-agnostic way.

name: Atomsk
one_line_profile: Tool for manipulating and converting atomic data files
detailed_description: A command-line tool for creating, manipulating, and converting atomic data files for various computational materials science codes (LAMMPS, VASP, etc.).

name: pic-python
one_line_profile: Vectorized Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma physics simulation
detailed_description: A compact, vectorized Python implementation of the Particle-in-Cell (PIC) method for plasma physics simulations. It solves the Vlasov-Maxwell system and is designed for educational and research prototyping purposes in plasma dynamics.

name: sph-python
one_line_profile: Smoothed-Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulation code
detailed_description: A Python implementation of Smoothed-Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) for simulating fluid dynamics and astrophysical phenomena (e.g., toy star models). It serves as a concise solver for mesh-free fluid simulations.

name: Python-Code-for-Stress-Constrained-Topology-Optimization-in-ABAQUS
one_line_profile: Topology optimization scripts for ABAQUS FEA
detailed_description: A Python-based tool for performing stress-constrained topology optimization within the ABAQUS Finite Element Analysis environment. It implements methods like Optimality Criteria and Method of Moving Asymptotes for 2D and 3D structural problems.

name: DEM-Engine
one_line_profile: Dual-GPU Discrete Element Method (DEM) solver for granular dynamics
detailed_description: A high-performance Discrete Element Method (DEM) solver leveraging dual-GPU acceleration. It supports complex grain geometries and is part of the Project Chrono ecosystem, designed for large-scale granular dynamics simulations.

name: ProtoCaller
one_line_profile: Automated workflow for relative protein-ligand binding free energy calculations
detailed_description: A Python library that automates relative protein-ligand binding free energy calculations using GROMACS. It handles ligand parametrization, system setup, and FEP simulation protocols.

name: PSC
one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma physics
detailed_description: A Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed for plasma physics simulations. It supports various algorithms for particle dynamics and field solving, suitable for research in plasma interactions.

name: pyiron
one_line_profile: Integrated development environment (IDE) for computational materials science workflows
detailed_description: An integrated development environment (IDE) for computational materials science that simplifies the setup, execution, and analysis of complex simulation workflows. It supports various simulation codes and manages data provenance.

name: pyiron_atomistics
one_line_profile: Atomistic simulation module for the pyiron materials science IDE
detailed_description: The atomistic simulation module of the pyiron IDE, providing interfaces and tools specifically for atomic-scale simulations (e.g., DFT, MD) within the pyiron framework.

name: pylammpsmpi
one_line_profile: Parallel Python interface for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics engine
detailed_description: A Python library that provides a parallel interface to LAMMPS, allowing users to control MPI-parallelized LAMMPS instances from a serial Python process or Jupyter notebook.

name: pyscal
one_line_profile: Library for calculating local atomic structural environments in atomistic simulations
detailed_description: A Python library (written in C++) for the calculation of local atomic structural environments and order parameters (e.g., Steinhardt parameters, Voronoi analysis) from atomistic simulation data.

name: Dock-MD-FEP
one_line_profile: Automated workflow for protein-ligand binding free energy calculations
detailed_description: An all-in-one open-source workflow for automated binding free energy calculations between proteins and small molecules. It integrates docking, molecular dynamics, and free energy perturbation (FEP) using OpenMM.

name: simba-ps
one_line_profile: Deterministic Lennard-Jones particle simulator using Numba acceleration
detailed_description: A fast, deterministic, all-Python particle simulator for Lennard-Jones systems. It utilizes Numba for GPU/CPU acceleration to perform efficient molecular dynamics simulations.

name: apic2d
one_line_profile: Affine Particle-in-Cell (APIC) solver for 2D fluid simulation
detailed_description: A C++ implementation of the Affine Particle-in-Cell (APIC) method for 2D water simulation. It serves as a high-quality reference implementation for hybrid Lagrangian-Eulerian fluid simulation techniques.

name: libwetcloth
one_line_profile: Multi-scale simulation library for liquid-fabric interactions
detailed_description: A multi-scale physics simulation library designed to model the interaction between liquids and fabrics. It handles complex dynamics involving wetting, saturation, and cloth mechanics.

name: restraintmaker
one_line_profile: Tool for generating position and distance restraints for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: A tool designed to build position or distance restraints for Molecular Dynamics simulations. It can operate as a script or a PyMOL plugin, offering various selection modes and optimizers to distribute restraints effectively.

name: XOOPIC
one_line_profile: 2D/3V Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulator for plasma physics
detailed_description: An open-source 2D, 3-velocity Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulator capable of handling electrostatic and electromagnetic models. It supports various boundary conditions and gas chemistry, widely used for plasma simulation.

name: do_x3dna
one_line_profile: Analysis tool for DNA/RNA structural fluctuations in MD trajectories
detailed_description: A Python tool to analyze fluctuations in DNA or RNA structures from molecular dynamics trajectories, leveraging the 3DNA analysis programs.

name: DEMLab
one_line_profile: Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulation tool in MATLAB
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based laboratory for Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulations, allowing for the modeling and analysis of granular material dynamics.

name: torchani-amber
one_line_profile: Interface for using ANI neural network potentials within Amber MD suite
detailed_description: An interface that enables the use of ANI-style neural network interatomic potentials (NN-IPs) within the Amber molecular dynamics software suite (sander and pmemd engines).

name: fmmgen
one_line_profile: Code generator for Fast Multipole Method (FMM) and Barnes-Hut operators
detailed_description: A tool for the automatic code generation of Fast Multipole Method (FMM) and Barnes-Hut operators, facilitating the development of high-performance N-body solvers.

name: elegant
one_line_profile: Accelerator physics code for beam dynamics and particle tracking
detailed_description: A widely used tool for simulating particle accelerators. It models beam dynamics, tracks particles, and optimizes accelerator parameters, serving as a standard code in the accelerator physics community.

name: OpenMMS
one_line_profile: Software for Mobile Mapping Systems (MMS) data processing
detailed_description: An open-source software project for Mobile Mapping Systems (MMS), handling data from hardware sensors (LiDAR, GPS/IMU) for geospatial mapping and analysis.

name: gromacs_py
one_line_profile: Python wrapper for simplifying GROMACS molecular dynamics workflows
detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies the use of the GROMACS MD simulation software. It automates topology building, system creation (solvation, ionization), and the execution of minimization, equilibration, and production runs.

name: SEEKR2
one_line_profile: Simulation-Enabled Estimation of Kinetic Rates (Version 2)
detailed_description: A software tool for calculating kinetics and thermodynamics of molecular binding using molecular dynamics and Brownian dynamics simulations.

name: Selalib
one_line_profile: Semi-Lagrangian Library for plasma physics simulations
detailed_description: A library of modular and reusable components for the simulation of kinetic equations in plasma physics, particularly using Semi-Lagrangian methods.

name: PEGgenerator
one_line_profile: Topology generator for PEG molecules in GROMACS and LAMMPS
detailed_description: A tool to generate topology files for Polyethylene Glycol (PEG) chains for use in molecular dynamics simulations with GROMACS or LAMMPS.

name: NMRforMD
one_line_profile: NMR relaxation time calculator from MD trajectories
detailed_description: A Python script for calculating NMR relaxation times (T1 and T2) from molecular dynamics trajectory files.

name: postpic
one_line_profile: Post-processor for Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations
detailed_description: An open-source Python package for post-processing and analyzing data from Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations.

name: lammps-USER-CONP2
one_line_profile: Constant potential plugin for LAMMPS
detailed_description: An updated constant potential plugin for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulator, enabling constant potential simulations.

name: poly3d
one_line_profile: Boundary element method for modeling faults and fractures
detailed_description: A C-based Boundary Element Method (BEM) code for modeling faults and fractures discretized into polygonal elements in geophysics.

name: NeuroFluid
one_line_profile: Fluid Dynamics Grounding with Particle-Driven Neural Radiance Fields
detailed_description: Implementation of NeuroFluid, a method for fluid dynamics grounding using particle-driven Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF).

name: lunar-astrodynamics-simulation
one_line_profile: Simulation of orbital dynamics under Moon's gravitational field
detailed_description: Numerical simulation tool for orbital dynamics under the Moon's non-uniform gravitational field (J2, mascons).

name: simple-simulate-complex
one_line_profile: Workflow for protein-ligand complex simulation with OpenMM
detailed_description: A workflow/script collection for performing protein-ligand complex simulations using the OpenMM toolkit.

name: ClayFF-GROMACS
one_line_profile: GROMACS implementation of the ClayFF force field
detailed_description: A repository providing the implementation and parameters of the ClayFF force field for use with the GROMACS molecular dynamics engine.

name: WAND-PIC
one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulation code
detailed_description: A Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma physics simulations.

name: nuc_dynamics
one_line_profile: Particle dynamics for chromosome structure calculation
detailed_description: A tool for particle dynamics and simulated annealing specifically designed for chromosome structure calculation.

name: mddatasetbuilder
one_line_profile: Dataset builder for neural network potentials from LAMMPS trajectories
detailed_description: A script to build reference datasets for training neural network potentials using data from LAMMPS trajectories.

name: mdgrad
one_line_profile: PyTorch differentiable molecular dynamics
detailed_description: A library for differentiable molecular dynamics simulations implemented in PyTorch, enabling gradient-based optimization of force field parameters.

name: TorchMD
one_line_profile: End-to-End Molecular Dynamics Engine using PyTorch
detailed_description: An end-to-end Molecular Dynamics (MD) engine written in PyTorch, designed for machine learning applications and differentiable simulations.

name: TTClust
one_line_profile: Clustering tool for molecular dynamics trajectories
detailed_description: A program to clusterize molecular dynamics trajectories from various engines (Amber, Gromacs, Charmm, NAMD, PDB).

name: protocolGromacs
one_line_profile: Automated GROMACS simulation protocol
detailed_description: An automated protocol for GROMACS simulations, covering steps from preparation to production, including ligand parametrization.

name: DMCF
one_line_profile: Momentum-conserving learning for particle-based fluid dynamics
detailed_description: Implementation of a method for guaranteed conservation of momentum in learning particle-based fluid dynamics (NeurIPS '22).

name: Particula
one_line_profile: Python-based aerosol simulator
detailed_description: An open-source aerosol simulator that captures gas-particle interactions, transformations, and dynamics for predictive aerosol science.

name: cfdemSolverIBPICI
one_line_profile: Resolved CFD-DEM solver
detailed_description: An alternative solver for fully resolved CFD-DEM simulations, developed by the Positron Imaging Centre.

name: hoomd-tf
one_line_profile: TensorFlow plugin for HOOMD-blue
detailed_description: A plugin that enables the use of TensorFlow within HOOMD-blue simulations for GPU-accelerated machine learning enhanced molecular dynamics.

name: JARVIS-Tools
one_line_profile: Open-source software package for data-driven atomistic materials design and analysis
detailed_description: JARVIS-Tools is a Python library for atomistic materials design, providing scripts for setting up calculations, analyzing results, and applying machine learning models to material properties. It supports various electronic structure codes and integrates with the JARVIS database.

name: DEMKit
one_line_profile: Discrete Element Method (DEM) toolkit for particle simulations
detailed_description: DEMKit is a toolkit for performing Discrete Element Method simulations, focusing on granular materials and particle mechanics. It serves as a core engine for research in particle dynamics.

name: PANTERA
one_line_profile: Simulation software for nonequilibrium gas and plasma flows using DSMC and PIC methods
detailed_description: PANTERA is an open-source solver developed by the Von Karman Institute for simulating nonequilibrium gas and plasma flows. It implements Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) and Particle-in-Cell (PIC) methods for rarefied gas dynamics and plasma physics.

name: VOTCA
one_line_profile: Coarse-grained modeling and charge transport analysis package
detailed_description: VOTCA is a software package for coarse-grained modeling (VOTCA-CSG) and simulation of charge transport in organic semiconductors (VOTCA-XTP). It provides tools for systematic coarse-graining, matching effective potentials, and analyzing molecular dynamics trajectories.

name: w2dynamics
one_line_profile: Continuous-time hybridization-expansion Monte Carlo solver for DMFT
detailed_description: w2dynamics is a software package for calculating n-particle Green's functions of the Anderson impurity model within dynamical mean-field theory (DMFT). It employs continuous-time quantum Monte Carlo (CT-QMC) in the hybridization-expansion formulation.

name: openMaelstrom
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated SPH fluid simulation engine with spatial adaptivity
detailed_description: openMaelstrom is an open-source Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulation framework designed for GPUs. It supports spatial adaptivity and is used for simulating fluid dynamics in physics and engineering contexts.

name: OpenMMDL
one_line_profile: Workflow interface for setting up OpenMM protein-ligand simulations
detailed_description: OpenMMDL acts as an interface to the OpenMM toolkit, simplifying the setup process for molecular dynamics simulations of protein-ligand complexes. It streamlines the preparation, configuration, and execution of MD runs.

name: xsuite
one_line_profile: Python suite for multiparticle simulations of particle accelerators
detailed_description: xsuite is a collection of Python packages designed for simulating the dynamics of particle beams in accelerators. It supports multiparticle tracking and beam physics simulations, optimized for modern computing architectures.

name: fmmlib2d
one_line_profile: Fast Multipole Method (FMM) library for 2D N-body problems
detailed_description: fmmlib2d is a Fortran library implementing the Fast Multipole Method in two dimensions. It is a core numerical component for accelerating N-body simulations and potential field calculations.

name: fmmlib3d
one_line_profile: Fast Multipole Method (FMM) library for 3D N-body problems
detailed_description: fmmlib3d is a Fortran library implementing the Fast Multipole Method in three dimensions. It provides efficient algorithms for computing potential fields and interactions in large-scale N-body simulations.

name: lammps-conp
one_line_profile: Constant potential method implementation for LAMMPS
detailed_description: lammps-conp is an extension for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulator that implements the constant potential method. It allows for the simulation of electrode-electrolyte interfaces where electrodes are maintained at a constant electrical potential.

name: PCISPH
one_line_profile: Predictive-Corrective Incompressible SPH fluid simulation solver
detailed_description: PCISPH is an OpenCL-accelerated implementation of the Predictive-Corrective Incompressible Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics method. It is used for simulating incompressible fluid flows with particle-based methods.

name: molview
one_line_profile: Jupyter widget for interactive molecular visualization based on Mol*
detailed_description: An IPython/Jupyter widget that brings the capabilities of the Mol* (Molstar) viewer into the notebook environment for interactive molecular visualization.

name: ADplugin
one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for AutoDock/Vina molecular docking
detailed_description: A plugin for the PyMOL molecular visualization system that integrates AutoDock and Vina, allowing users to set up and analyze molecular docking simulations directly within PyMOL.

name: Alphafold2import
one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin to import AlphaFold2 models from EMBL database
detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin that facilitates the fetching and importing of AlphaFold2 predicted protein structures hosted by EMBL directly into the PyMOL environment.

name: Jupyter_Dock
one_line_profile: Interactive molecular docking protocols in Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: A set of Jupyter Notebooks designed to perform molecular docking protocols interactively, including visualization, file format conversion, and result analysis.

name: molecular-design-toolkit
one_line_profile: Notebook-integrated tools for molecular simulation and visualization
detailed_description: A toolkit that integrates molecular simulation and visualization capabilities directly into Jupyter notebooks, facilitating computational chemistry workflows.

name: notebook-molecular-visualization
one_line_profile: 2D and 3D molecular visualization in Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: Provides capabilities for embedding 2D and 3D molecular visualizations within Jupyter notebooks using 3Dmol.js and D3.js libraries.

name: PyMOL-PUB
one_line_profile: Plugin for generating publication-quality structure figures in PyMOL
detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin designed to streamline the creation of high-quality, publication-ready molecular structure figures.

name: PyMolSAR
one_line_profile: Toolkit for molecular feature computation and activity prediction
detailed_description: A Python toolkit used to compute molecular features and predict biological activities and properties of small molecules, often used in SAR studies.

name: hop
one_line_profile: Solvent network analysis tool based on MDAnalysis
detailed_description: A Python package based on MDAnalysis for analyzing solvation dynamics and solvent networks in molecular dynamics simulations.

name: imdclient
one_line_profile: Client for streaming analysis from running MD simulations
detailed_description: A Python client for performing streaming analysis on molecular dynamics simulations while they are running, supporting interactive MD workflows.

name: propkatraj
one_line_profile: pKa estimates for proteins using MD trajectories
detailed_description: A tool to calculate pKa values for protein residues across an ensemble of structures from molecular dynamics trajectories.

name: zarrtraj
one_line_profile: MDAnalysis toolkit for Zarr-based trajectory storage
detailed_description: An MDAKit that provides functionality for reading and writing molecular dynamics trajectories using the Zarr format within the MDAnalysis ecosystem.

name: ASAP
one_line_profile: Automatic Selection And Prediction tools for structural analysis
detailed_description: ASAP is a python package for quickly analyzing and visualizing datasets of crystal or molecular structures, often used in conjunction with machine learning potentials.

name: ring-pymol
one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for Residue Interaction Network Generator (RING)
detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin that visualizes residue interaction networks generated by the RING software, aiding in the analysis of protein structure stability and function.

name: MasterMSM
one_line_profile: Python package for generating Markov State Models
detailed_description: A Python package designed for the construction and analysis of Markov State Models (MSMs) from molecular dynamics simulation data.

name: domhmm
one_line_profile: Tool to identify nano- and microdomains in membrane MD simulations
detailed_description: An open source package used to identify and analyze lipid domains (nano- and microdomains) in molecular dynamics simulations of biological membranes.

name: NetworkGT
one_line_profile: Network Geometry and Topology Toolbox for fracture networks
detailed_description: A toolbox for the geometrical and topological analysis of fracture networks, applicable in geophysics and materials science.

name: Jmol-SwingJS
one_line_profile: SwingJS-compatible version of Jmol/JSmol
detailed_description: A version of the Jmol molecular visualization and analysis tool compatible with SwingJS, enabling Java-based molecular tools to run in web environments.

name: Molecules
one_line_profile: 3D molecular visualizer for iOS
detailed_description: An open-source application for viewing and manipulating 3D molecular structures on iOS devices.

name: MoleculesMac
one_line_profile: 3D molecular visualizer for macOS
detailed_description: The macOS desktop version of the Molecules application for visualizing 3D molecular structures.

name: MolecularNodes
one_line_profile: Molecular animation and visualization in Blender via Geometry Nodes
detailed_description: A Blender add-on that enables the import and manipulation of molecular data using Geometry Nodes for high-quality visualization and animation.

name: Caleydo
one_line_profile: Visualization framework for molecular biology data
detailed_description: Caleydo is a visualization framework and tool designed to help life science experts analyze and explore large-scale molecular biology data.

name: DISC
one_line_profile: Single-molecule trajectory idealization tool
detailed_description: A MATLAB tool for single-molecule trajectory idealization using divisive segmentation and clustering, developed by ChandaLab.

name: colvars
one_line_profile: Collective variables library for molecular simulation
detailed_description: A software module for molecular simulation programs that provides a flexible and robust implementation of collective variables and enhanced sampling methods.

name: phlower
one_line_profile: Trajectory analysis using Hodge decomposition
detailed_description: A Python tool that utilizes Hodge decomposition for the analysis of trajectories, providing insights into the global structure of dynamics.

name: pymol-remote
one_line_profile: Remote interface for PyMOL visualization from compute clusters
detailed_description: A utility to send data to and from a local PyMOL instance from a remote server, facilitating visualization workflows where heavy computation (e.g., deep learning, MD) occurs on a cluster.

name: CueMol
one_line_profile: Interactive molecular visualization framework
detailed_description: CueMol is a molecular visualization framework designed to visualize crystallographic data and molecular coordinates, supporting various rendering modes and scene setups.

name: msys
one_line_profile: System preparation and analysis library for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: A library developed by D. E. Shaw Research for preparing and analyzing chemical systems for molecular dynamics simulations, handling topology and structure data.

name: Building-Regulariser
one_line_profile: Geospatial tool for regularizing building footprints
detailed_description: A Python library for cleaning and regularizing building footprints in geospatial data, aligning edges to principal directions and simplifying polygons for accurate analysis.

name: u-track
one_line_profile: Multiple-particle tracking software for dense fields
detailed_description: A software package for multiple-particle tracking, designed to handle dense particle fields, close gaps in trajectories, and capture merging/splitting events in biological or physical imaging data.

name: Persistence
one_line_profile: Topological Data Analysis (TDA) library for Haskell
detailed_description: A library for computing persistent homology and other topological features from data, enabling topological data analysis in the Haskell programming environment.

name: vmd-python
one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Visual Molecular Dynamics (VMD)
detailed_description: An installable Python module that wraps the VMD (Visual Molecular Dynamics) software, allowing VMD's analysis and visualization capabilities to be used directly within Python scripts.

name: PathCV
one_line_profile: Path collective variable implementation for PLUMED
detailed_description: Source code for the Path collective variable implementation within the PLUMED software, used for enhanced sampling and free energy calculations along a defined path.

name: LITAP
one_line_profile: R package for terrain analysis and hydrology modeling
detailed_description: An R package for terrain analysis, landscape, and hydrology models, building on LandMapR methodologies to calculate flow topology and landform segmentation.

name: FairRoot
one_line_profile: Simulation and analysis framework for particle physics
detailed_description: A C++ framework for simulation, reconstruction, and analysis of particle physics experiments, providing a base for developing experiment-specific software.

name: PINES
one_line_profile: Permutationally Invariant Networks for Enhanced Sampling
detailed_description: A tool implementing Permutationally Invariant Networks for Enhanced Sampling (PINES) to improve sampling efficiency in molecular simulations.

name: loosely_coupled_ekf

detailed_description: A ROS node implementing a 6-DOF loosely-coupled error state Extended Kalman Filter (EKF) for state estimation in robotics and navigation.

name: GEMDAT
one_line_profile: Python toolkit for molecular dynamics analysis
detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for the analysis of molecular dynamics simulations, facilitating the extraction of insights from trajectory data.

name: GUDHI
one_line_profile: Library for Topological Data Analysis (TDA)
detailed_description: A generic open-source C++ library with a Python interface for Topological Data Analysis (TDA) and Higher Dimensional Geometry Understanding, offering state-of-the-art algorithms for persistent homology.

name: global-chem
one_line_profile: Chemical knowledge graph and toolkit
detailed_description: A knowledge graph and software toolkit mapping common chemical names to their molecular definitions (SMILES, InChI), facilitating chemical data integration and informatics.

name: LOOS
one_line_profile: Lightweight Object-Oriented Structure analysis library
detailed_description: A lightweight C++ library for analyzing molecular dynamics simulations and structural biology data, designed for ease of use and creating new analysis tools.

name: CONAN
one_line_profile: Contact analysis tool for MD trajectories
detailed_description: A tool for the analysis of inter-atomic contacts in molecular dynamics trajectories, providing statistical and time-dependent analysis of interactions.

name: MD-IFP
one_line_profile: MD trajectory analysis using Interaction Fingerprints
detailed_description: Tools for analyzing Molecular Dynamics trajectories by calculating and visualizing protein-ligand Interaction Fingerprints (IFP).

name: mdgo
one_line_profile: MD simulation setup and analysis codebase
detailed_description: A codebase for setting up classical molecular dynamics simulations and analyzing the results, developed by the Hou Group.

name: MDANSE
one_line_profile: Molecular Dynamics Analysis for Neutron Scattering Experiments
detailed_description: An interactive program for computing neutron scattering observables from molecular dynamics trajectories, bridging simulation and experiment.

name: Correlation
one_line_profile: Material correlation function calculator
detailed_description: A C++ program that calculates main correlation functions of a material, including Radial Distribution Function (RDF), Pair Distribution Function (PDF), and Plane Angle Distribution (PAD).

name: metadynminer.py

detailed_description: A Python package for efficient reading, plotting, and analysis of HILLS files generated by Plumed metadynamics simulations, inspired by the R metadynminer package.

name: trajr

detailed_description: A toolbox to assist with the statistical analysis of 2-dimensional animal trajectories. It provides functions for calculating metrics like speed, acceleration, and tortuosity, and for resampling and smoothing trajectory data.

name: PymolFold

detailed_description: A plugin for PyMOL that interfaces with protein folding prediction services (like ESMFold) to predict and visualize protein structures directly within the PyMOL environment.

name: Drifters.jl
one_line_profile: Trajectory simulations for particles in Ocean and Atmosphere
detailed_description: A Julia package for computing the trajectories of point particles (drifters) in oceanic and atmospheric flow fields, useful for climate science and fluid dynamics simulations.

name: PyBILT
one_line_profile: Toolkit for lipid bilayer molecular simulation analysis
detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed to aid in the analysis of lipid bilayer molecular dynamics trajectories, offering specialized functions for membrane properties.

name: MDAPackmol
one_line_profile: MDAnalysis wrapper for Packmol
detailed_description: A Python wrapper that integrates the Packmol software with MDAnalysis, allowing users to generate initial configurations for molecular dynamics simulations programmatically.

name: MDAnalysisData
one_line_profile: Datasets for MDAnalysis testing and workshops
detailed_description: A Python library providing programmatic access to standard molecular dynamics datasets, used for testing, benchmarking, and educational purposes within the MDAnalysis ecosystem.

name: mdacli
one_line_profile: Command line interface for MDAnalysis
detailed_description: A command-line tool that exposes MDAnalysis functionality, allowing users to perform common trajectory analysis tasks without writing Python scripts.

name: MDAnalysis
one_line_profile: Python library for analyzing molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: A robust and widely used Python library for the analysis of molecular dynamics trajectories. It supports a wide range of file formats and provides tools for distance calculation, alignment, and custom analysis.

name: membrane-curvature
one_line_profile: MDAnalysis tool to calculate membrane curvature
detailed_description: A specialized tool within the MDAnalysis ecosystem for calculating and mapping the curvature of lipid membranes from molecular dynamics simulations.

name: pmda
one_line_profile: Parallel algorithms for MDAnalysis
detailed_description: A library that implements parallel analysis algorithms for MDAnalysis, enabling faster processing of large molecular dynamics trajectories using multiprocessing.

name: OpticalRayTracer
one_line_profile: Optical ray tracing simulation in MATLAB
detailed_description: A simulation tool based on Snell's law and Fresnel equations for performing optical ray tracing, useful for optics and physics education or simple modeling.

name: GetBox-PyMOL-Plugin
one_line_profile: PyMOL Plugin for calculating docking boxes
detailed_description: A plugin for PyMOL that assists in defining and calculating the docking box coordinates for molecular docking software like LeDock, AutoDock, and AutoDock Vina.

name: trajectory-cluster
one_line_profile: Trajectory Clustering: Partition-and-Group Framework
detailed_description: A Python implementation of a partition-and-group framework for trajectory clustering, useful for analyzing movement patterns in spatial data.

name: MobilityDB
one_line_profile: Geospatial trajectory data management platform
detailed_description: An extension for PostgreSQL and PostGIS that adds support for temporal and spatio-temporal objects, enabling efficient management and analysis of geospatial trajectory data.

name: ili
one_line_profile: Web-based visualization of molecular maps
detailed_description: A web-based application for the 2D and 3D visualization of molecular maps and spatial data, facilitating the exploration of molecular cartography.

name: EasyPyMOL
one_line_profile: Script to facilitate the creation of horizontal scripts for PyMOL
detailed_description: EasyPyMOL is a utility script designed to streamline the workflow in PyMOL by facilitating the creation of horizontal scripts, enhancing productivity for structural biology visualization.

name: jupyterlabpymolpysnips
one_line_profile: PyMOL code snippets for JupyterLab integration
detailed_description: A collection of Python snippets for PyMOL designed to be run in JupyterLab via the jupyterlab-snippets-multimenus extension, facilitating interactive molecular visualization workflows.

name: pymolshortcuts
one_line_profile: Productivity shortcuts and extensions for PyMOL
detailed_description: A collection of shortcuts loaded on PyMOL startup to enable web searches from within the application and provide convenient functions for enhanced productivity in molecular visualization.
