name: abcv
one_line_profile: Python-based crystal viewer built upon fresnel and pymatgen
detailed_description: A crystal structure viewer that leverages the fresnel ray tracing library and pymatgen for high-quality visualization of materials.

name: mdapy
one_line_profile: Library to handle data generated from molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: A Python library designed for efficient handling and analysis of data generated from molecular dynamics simulations, providing various analysis functions.

name: pesnet
one_line_profile: Ab-Initio Potential Energy Surfaces by Pairing GNNs with Neural Wave Functions
detailed_description: Reference implementation for generating ab-initio potential energy surfaces using Graph Neural Networks paired with Neural Wave Functions.

name: stmol
one_line_profile: Streamlit component for rendering molecules using py3Dmol
detailed_description: A component for the Streamlit framework that enables the rendering and visualization of molecular structures within web applications using py3Dmol.

name: NolinearTimeSeriesAnalysis
one_line_profile: Toolbox for nonlinear time series analysis
detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for performing nonlinear time series analysis, including phase space reconstruction, recurrence network construction, and complexity-entropy plane computation.

name: FETA3
one_line_profile: Framework for Evolving Topology Analysis
detailed_description: A Java-based software framework for analyzing evolving graph topologies and networks.

name: nglview
one_line_profile: Jupyter widget for interactive molecular visualization
detailed_description: A Jupyter widget that allows for interactive viewing of molecular structures and trajectories directly within Jupyter notebooks.

name: fractopo
one_line_profile: Tool for validating and analyzing lineament and fracture trace maps
detailed_description: A Python package providing tools for the validation and analysis of geological lineament and fracture trace maps, useful in geophysics and structural geology.

name: relax
one_line_profile: Software for molecular dynamics analysis by NMR data
detailed_description: A software package for the analysis of molecular dynamics using experimental NMR data, supporting various relaxation analysis techniques.

name: VMD-SWTTV
one_line_profile: Denoising algorithm combining Variational Mode Decomposition and Stationary Wavelet Transform
detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a two-stage denoising framework for 1D signals, combining Variational Mode Decomposition (VMD) with Stationary Wavelet Transform (SWT) optimized by Total Variation.

name: modtox
one_line_profile: Platform to analyze MD trajectories using ML and clustering
detailed_description: An in silico platform designed to analyze molecular dynamics trajectories using various metrics, clustering algorithms, and machine/deep learning techniques.

name: IQmol
one_line_profile: Molecular editor and visualization package
detailed_description: An open-source molecular editor and visualization software that allows users to build molecules, set up calculations, and analyze results, often used with the Q-Chem quantum chemistry package.

name: NGLVieweR
one_line_profile: Visualize PDB and structural files in R and Shiny
detailed_description: An R package that provides an interface to the NGL.js library, enabling the visualization and interaction with Protein Data Bank (PDB) and other structural files within R and Shiny applications.

name: shinyNGLVieweR
one_line_profile: Shiny UI for the NGLVieweR package
detailed_description: A dedicated Shiny UI wrapper for the NGLVieweR package, facilitating the integration of molecular visualization into Shiny web applications.

name: openmm-plumed
one_line_profile: OpenMM plugin to interface with PLUMED
detailed_description: A plugin that connects the OpenMM molecular simulation toolkit with the PLUMED library, enabling enhanced sampling and free energy calculations within OpenMM.

name: g_count
one_line_profile: Gromacs tools for characterizing water movement in cylindrical regions
detailed_description: A set of Gromacs-compatible tools (g_count, g_flux) to analyze the occupancy and flux of particles (e.g., water) through cylindrical regions like ion channels or nanotubes.

name: DockingPie
one_line_profile: Consensus Docking Plugin for PyMOL
detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin designed to facilitate consensus docking analysis, allowing users to perform and analyze molecular docking simulations within the PyMOL environment.

name: PyPowerSim
one_line_profile: Toolkit for simulation of power converter topologies
detailed_description: A Python toolkit for simulating standard power converter topologies, offering capabilities for waveform analysis, steady-state calculation, and transient analysis.

name: wSterimol
one_line_profile: Generate Boltzmann-weighted Sterimol Steric Parameters
detailed_description: A Python tool to calculate Boltzmann-weighted Sterimol steric parameters for conformationally flexible substituents, useful in quantitative structure-activity relationship (QSAR) studies.

name: Mapper
one_line_profile: R package for computing the Mapper construction from Topological Data Analysis
detailed_description: An R package that implements the Mapper algorithm, a tool from Topological Data Analysis (TDA) for visualizing and analyzing high-dimensional data.

name: INFOTOPO
one_line_profile: Programs for Information Topology Data Analysis
detailed_description: A suite of programs for performing Information Topology Data Analysis, applying topological methods to information theory contexts.

name: atomsk
one_line_profile: Tool for manipulating and converting atomic data files
detailed_description: A command-line tool for creating, manipulating, and converting atomic data files for materials science simulations (e.g., LAMMPS, VASP, Quantum Espresso).

name: PLUMED 2
one_line_profile: Open-source library for enhanced sampling and free energy calculations
detailed_description: A library that works with various molecular dynamics engines to perform enhanced sampling, free energy calculations, and analysis of molecular systems using collective variables.

name: polyhedral-template-matching
one_line_profile: Polyhedral Template Matching algorithm for MD analysis
detailed_description: An implementation of the Polyhedral Template Matching (PTM) algorithm for classifying local atomic structures in molecular dynamics simulations.

name: Particle Flow Simulator
one_line_profile: Simulator for 3D particle positions and trajectories from tree graphs
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based simulator that takes .swc tree graphs as input and outputs 3D particle positions as trajectories and steady-state frames, developed by the Provost Ultrasound Lab.

name: PyMod
one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for sequence similarity searches and homology modeling
detailed_description: PyMod 3 is a plugin for PyMOL that enables sequence similarity searches, multiple sequence/structure alignments, and homology modeling directly within the PyMOL environment.

name: BondPack
one_line_profile: Collection of PyMOL plugins to visualize atomic bonds
detailed_description: A collection of plugins for the PyMOL molecular visualization system designed to enhance the visualization of atomic bonds.

name: Spatio-Temporal-DBSCAN
one_line_profile: Spatio-Temporal DBSCAN algorithm implementation for trajectory clustering
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Spatio-Temporal DBSCAN algorithm, designed to cluster spatio-temporal data with irregular time intervals, such as GPS trajectories.

name: MAGMATOMIX-UMD_package
one_line_profile: Post-processing package for ab initio molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: A post-processing package that performs analysis of structural, transport, and thermodynamic properties from ab initio molecular dynamics simulations.

name: P2Rank
one_line_profile: Machine learning-based protein-ligand binding site prediction tool
detailed_description: P2Rank is a standalone command-line tool for predicting ligand-binding pockets from a protein structure using machine learning.

name: schrodinger_utils
one_line_profile: Analysis tools and integrations for Schrodinger/Desmond MD simulations
detailed_description: A collection of integrations and analysis tools for the Schrodinger ecosystem, with a focus on Molecular Dynamics simulations run with Desmond.

name: Restraintmaker
one_line_profile: Tool to build restraints for Molecular Dynamics simulations
detailed_description: Restraintmaker is a tool intended to build Position or Distance restraints for Molecular Dynamics simulations. It can be used as a library or an interactive PyMOL plugin.

name: TDAstats
one_line_profile: R pipeline for computing persistent homology in topological data analysis
detailed_description: An R package for computing persistent homology in topological data analysis (TDA), providing a pipeline for statistical analysis of topological features.

name: Tracktable
one_line_profile: Library for moving object trajectory analysis and rendering
detailed_description: Tracktable provides a set of tools for analyzing and rendering the paths of moving objects (trajectories) in C++ and Python.

name: VIAMD
one_line_profile: Visual Interactive Analysis of Molecular Dynamics
detailed_description: VIAMD is a tool for the visual interactive analysis of molecular dynamics simulations, allowing users to explore and analyze MD trajectories.

name: PyMOL Open Source
one_line_profile: Open-source molecular visualization system
detailed_description: The open-source foundation of the PyMOL molecular visualization system, widely used for 3D visualization of proteins, small molecules, and other biological structures.

name: scikit-tda
one_line_profile: Topological Data Analysis for Python
detailed_description: A metapackage and library for Topological Data Analysis (TDA) in Python, providing a unified interface for various TDA tools and algorithms.

name: TaDAsets
one_line_profile: Synthetic data sets for Topological Data Analysis
detailed_description: A library for generating synthetic data sets specifically designed for testing and benchmarking Topological Data Analysis (TDA) algorithms.

name: Vipster
one_line_profile: Visualization and editing of periodic molecular structure files
detailed_description: Vipster is a tool for the visualization and editing of periodic molecular structure files, supporting various file formats.

name: VMD_python
one_line_profile: Python implementation of Variational Mode Decomposition for signal analysis
detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Variational Mode Decomposition (VMD) algorithm, a non-recursive signal processing method used to decompose a signal into a discrete number of band-limited modes. Useful for time-series analysis in physics and engineering.

name: MPTRAC
one_line_profile: Massive-Parallel Trajectory Calculations for atmospheric transport
detailed_description: A Lagrangian particle dispersion model designed for the analysis of atmospheric transport processes in the free troposphere and stratosphere. It performs massive-parallel trajectory calculations to simulate particle dispersion.

name: pymol_viridis
one_line_profile: Colorblind-friendly and perceptually uniform palettes for PyMOL
detailed_description: A plugin/script for PyMOL that adds colorblind-friendly and perceptually uniform colormaps (like Viridis, Magma, Plasma, Inferno) to enhance molecular visualization quality.

name: PyVibMS
one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for visualizing molecular vibrations
detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin designed to visualize vibrational modes in molecules and solids, aiding in the analysis of spectroscopic data and structural dynamics.

name: PSICO
one_line_profile: PyMOL Script Collection for enhanced structural analysis
detailed_description: A comprehensive collection of Python scripts for PyMOL (Pymol ScrIpt COllection), extending its functionality for structural analysis, geometric calculations, and visualization tasks.

name: loo
one_line_profile: Efficient leave-one-out cross-validation for Bayesian models
detailed_description: An R package for efficient approximate leave-one-out cross-validation (LOO-CV) and Pareto smoothed importance sampling (PSIS), widely used for model comparison and validation in Bayesian statistical analysis.

name: tradeSeq
one_line_profile: Trajectory-based differential expression analysis for sequencing data
detailed_description: A statistical tool for analyzing gene expression changes along biological trajectories (e.g., developmental lineages). It uses generalized additive models to test for differential expression associated with lineages and pseudotime.

name: MoguTDA
one_line_profile: Topological Data Analysis toolkit for simplicial complexes
detailed_description: A Python package for Topological Data Analysis (TDA), focusing on simplicial complexes and algebraic topology computations. Useful for analyzing the shape and structure of high-dimensional scientific data.

name: PyTDA
one_line_profile: Python library for Topological Data Analysis
detailed_description: A library for performing Topological Data Analysis (TDA) in Python, providing tools to compute persistent homology and other topological features from data sets.

name: proteinpaint
one_line_profile: Visualization framework for genomic and protein data integration
detailed_description: A web-based visualization application for exploring genomic alterations (mutations, fusions) in the context of protein structure and function. Developed by St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.

name: OLIGAMIX
one_line_profile: Tool for tracking oligomerization states in MD simulations
detailed_description: A lightweight analysis tool designed to track oligomerization states and inter-chain contact networks from molecular dynamics (MD) simulation trajectories. Developed by the Strodel group.

name: r3dmol
one_line_profile: R interface for 3D molecular visualization using 3Dmol.js
detailed_description: An R package that provides an interface to the 3Dmol.js library, allowing users to visualize and interact with molecular structures directly within R, RMarkdown, and Shiny applications.

name: reax_tools
one_line_profile: High-performance analysis tool for ReaxFF/AIMD trajectories
detailed_description: A graph-theory based analysis tool designed for processing trajectories from ReaxFF (Reactive Force Field) and AIMD (Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics) simulations, enabling chemical species identification and reaction tracking.

name: traja
one_line_profile: Python tools for spatial trajectory analysis
detailed_description: A Python library for the analysis and visualization of animal trajectory data. It provides methods for geometric analysis, clustering, and modeling of movement paths.

name: trajminer
one_line_profile: Trajectory Mining Library for Python
detailed_description: A library dedicated to trajectory data mining, providing algorithms for preprocessing, similarity calculation, clustering, and classification of trajectory data.

name: trident-chemwidgets
one_line_profile: Jupyter Widgets for interactive molecular dataset visualization
detailed_description: A set of Jupyter Widgets that enable interactive exploration and visualization of molecular datasets directly within Jupyter notebooks, facilitating chemical data analysis.

name: peptidesim
one_line_profile: Automated peptide simulation workflow tool
detailed_description: An automated workflow tool for setting up and running peptide molecular dynamics simulations using GROMACS and PLUMED. Developed by the White Lab at University of Rochester.

name: MachUpX
one_line_profile: Fast and accurate aerodynamic modeling using numerical lifting-line theory
detailed_description: A Python library for aerodynamic modeling that implements general numerical lifting-line theory. It allows for the simulation and analysis of aircraft aerodynamics, providing tools for calculating forces, moments, and derivatives.

name: pyRMSD
one_line_profile: Efficient RMSD calculations for large sets of molecular structures
detailed_description: A Python package optimized for fast collective Root Mean Square Deviation (RMSD) calculations, such as pairwise RMSD matrices, for large sets of structural data.

name: vmdpy
one_line_profile: Variational Mode Decomposition (VMD) implementation in Python
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Variational Mode Decomposition algorithm, a signal processing technique used for decomposing a signal into a discrete number of sub-signals (modes), applicable in time-series analysis of physical systems.

name: pdbcolor
one_line_profile: Utility to color PDB structures based on sequence alignment parameters
detailed_description: A Python tool that assigns colors to PDB structures based on quantitative data derived from multiple sequence alignments, aiding in the visualization of evolutionary conservation or other sequence-based properties on 3D structures.

name: PySDKit
one_line_profile: Library for signal decomposition algorithms
detailed_description: A Python library providing various signal decomposition algorithms (like EMD, EEMD, VMD) for analyzing non-linear and non-stationary time-series data, suitable for physical signal analysis.

name: traclus
one_line_profile: Implementation of the TRACLUS trajectory clustering algorithm
detailed_description: A Java implementation of the 'Trajectory Clustering: A Partition-and-Group Framework' (TRACLUS) algorithm, used for discovering common sub-trajectories in spatial trajectory data.

name: artefact
one_line_profile: Autoencoder and t-SNE for anomaly detection in aircraft trajectories
detailed_description: A toolset for detecting anomalies in aircraft trajectories using deep learning (Autoencoders) and dimensionality reduction (t-SNE) techniques.

name: PyMOL-Wasm
one_line_profile: WebAssembly port of the PyMOL molecular visualization system
detailed_description: A port of the PyMOL molecular visualization system to WebAssembly, enabling molecular structures to be viewed and analyzed directly in a web browser.

name: trajectory2vec
one_line_profile: Deep representation learning for trajectory clustering
detailed_description: An implementation of a deep learning approach to learn representations (embeddings) of trajectories, facilitating downstream tasks like clustering and classification of movement data.

name: pytorch-deep-markov-model
one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Deep Markov Models for time series
detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of Structured Inference Networks for Nonlinear State Space Models (Deep Markov Models), useful for modeling complex temporal dynamics and time-series data.

name: MDToolbox
one_line_profile: MATLAB/Octave toolbox for statistical analysis of MD trajectories
detailed_description: A toolbox for MATLAB and Octave designed for the statistical analysis of molecular dynamics trajectories, including functions for I/O, least-squares fitting, and various structural analysis metrics.

name: Trajectory-PMB-EOT-BP
one_line_profile: Trajectory Poisson Multi-Bernoulli filter for extended object tracking
detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a trajectory Poisson multi-Bernoulli (PMB) filter using particle belief propagation, designed for tracking multiple extended objects and estimating their trajectories.

name: fenics-topopt
one_line_profile: Topology optimization using FEniCS
detailed_description: A Python implementation of topology optimization algorithms utilizing the FEniCS finite element analysis library, suitable for structural optimization problems.

name: SPaMD
one_line_profile: Integrated platform for atomic-scale materials modeling, simulation, and visualization
detailed_description: SPaMD (Scalable Parallel Materials/Molecular Design/Dynamics Studio) is an integrated software platform dedicated to the modeling, calculation, simulation, analysis, and visualization of materials at the atomic scale. It is developed by the research group of Professor Ruifeng Zhang at Beihang University.

name: AMReX-Astro Microphysics
one_line_profile: Collection of microphysics routines for astrophysical simulations
detailed_description: This repository contains common astrophysical microphysics modules (nuclear networks, equations of state, opacity) designed to interface with AMReX-based simulation codes like Castro and MAESTROeX.

name: taichi.js
one_line_profile: Modern GPU compute and physics rendering in JavaScript
detailed_description: taichi.js is a JavaScript library that enables developers to write high-performance GPU compute and rendering kernels (based on the Taichi programming language concepts) directly in the browser, suitable for web-based physics simulations and visualizations.

name: rscope
one_line_profile: RL training visualizer for Mujoco Playground environments
detailed_description: rscope is a visualization tool for Reinforcement Learning training processes, specifically designed for Mujoco Playground environments and Brax. It aids in analyzing the behavior and performance of physics-based control policies.

name: PyQUDA
one_line_profile: Python interface for the QUDA library for Lattice QCD
detailed_description: PyQUDA provides a Pythonic interface to QUDA, a library for performing Lattice Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD) calculations on GPUs. It facilitates QCD research by combining Python's ease of use with QUDA's performance.

name: larnd-sim
one_line_profile: Simulation framework for DUNE pixelated Liquid Argon TPC
detailed_description: larnd-sim is a simulation framework specifically designed for the pixelated Liquid Argon Time Projection Chambers (LArTPC) used in the DUNE experiment. It simulates the detector response and physics of neutrino interactions.

name: evox
one_line_profile: Distributed GPU-Accelerated Framework for Evolutionary Computation
detailed_description: A comprehensive library and distributed GPU-accelerated framework for evolutionary computation algorithms and benchmark problems.

name: metade
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated evolutionary framework for Differential Evolution
detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated evolutionary framework that optimizes Differential Evolution (DE) strategies via meta-level evolution, supporting JAX and PyTorch.

name: tensorneat
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT)
detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated implementation of the NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT) algorithm for evolving neural networks.

name: tensorrvea
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Evolutionary Multiobjective Optimization
detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated framework for Evolutionary Multiobjective Optimization using Tensorized RVEA (Reference Vector Guided Evolutionary Algorithm).

name: NeRF-NCNN
one_line_profile: NeRF implementation in NCNN with C++ and Vulkan
detailed_description: A C++ implementation of Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) using the NCNN framework and Vulkan for efficient inference, enabling 3D scene reconstruction and rendering.

name: AdaPT
one_line_profile: Physically based mesh renderer based on Taichi lang
detailed_description: A physically based path tracer (Ada Path Tracer) implemented in Taichi, designed for rendering meshes with physical accuracy.

name: amr-wind
one_line_profile: AMReX-based structured wind solver
detailed_description: A massively parallel, block-structured adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) code for wind farm simulations, built on the AMReX library.

name: GRTeclyn
one_line_profile: Port of GRChombo to AMReX for General Relativity simulations
detailed_description: A numerical relativity code porting the functionality of GRChombo to the AMReX framework, enabling adaptive mesh refinement simulations of General Relativity.

name: nBody
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated N-Body particle simulator with visualizer
detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated N-Body particle simulator that includes a visualizer, designed for simulating gravitational or electrostatic interactions between particles.

name: N-body-simulation
one_line_profile: Real-time N-body simulation with Barnes-Hut and CUDA
detailed_description: A real-time N-body simulation tool implementing the Barnes-Hut algorithm and accelerated with CUDA.

name: jaxrenderer
one_line_profile: Differentiable Rasteriser implemented in JAX
detailed_description: A differentiable rasterizer implemented in JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization for rendering tasks, useful in inverse graphics and physics.

name: ddcMD
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated molecular dynamics for Martini force field
detailed_description: A fully GPU-accelerated molecular dynamics program specifically optimized for the Martini coarse-grained force field.

name: exadis
one_line_profile: Exascale Dislocation Simulator for Discrete Dislocation Dynamics
detailed_description: A portable library for Discrete Dislocation Dynamics (DDD) simulations that runs on GPUs, designed for exascale materials science simulations.

name: SIMULATeQCD
one_line_profile: Multi-GPU Lattice QCD framework
detailed_description: A multi-GPU Lattice QCD framework designed to make it easy for physicists to implement lattice QCD formulas while providing competitive performance.

name: SevenNet
one_line_profile: Graph neural network interatomic potential for multi-GPU MD simulations
detailed_description: SevenNet is a graph neural network interatomic potential package designed for efficient multi-GPU parallel molecular dynamics simulations, enabling large-scale and long-time simulations of materials.

name: pytorch-softdtw-cuda
one_line_profile: Fast CUDA implementation of SoftDTW for PyTorch
detailed_description: A highly optimized CUDA implementation of Soft Dynamic Time Warping (SoftDTW) for PyTorch, enabling differentiable time series alignment and analysis on GPUs.

name: pycharge
one_line_profile: Electromagnetics simulation library for moving point charges
detailed_description: PyCharge is a Python library built on JAX for simulating the electromagnetic fields and potentials generated by moving point charges, supporting differentiable simulations.

name: NVIDIA Warp
one_line_profile: Python framework for high-performance simulation and graphics
detailed_description: Warp is a Python framework that provides a high-performance JIT compiler for writing differentiable graphics and physics simulation kernels that run on the GPU.

name: ProtoMotions
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated simulation for digital humans and robots
detailed_description: ProtoMotions is a GPU-accelerated simulation and learning framework designed for training physically simulated digital humans and humanoid robots using reinforcement learning.

name: feax
one_line_profile: JAX-based finite element analysis engine
detailed_description: feax is a compact, high-performance finite element analysis (FEA) engine built on JAX, enabling differentiable structural analysis and optimization.

name: pennylane-lightning-kokkos
one_line_profile: Kokkos-enabled Lightning simulator for PennyLane
detailed_description: A high-performance state-vector simulator for the PennyLane quantum machine learning library, utilizing Kokkos for parallel execution on various hardware backends (CPU/GPU).

name: beamz
one_line_profile: Electromagnetic simulation and inverse design tool
detailed_description: beamz is a Python library for fast electromagnetic simulation and inverse design, utilizing JAX for differentiability and acceleration.

name: Octo-Tiger
one_line_profile: Astrophysics simulation code using fast multipole method on adaptive Octrees
detailed_description: An astrophysics code for simulating the evolution of star systems (like binary star mergers). It uses the Fast Multipole Method (FMM) on adaptive Octrees and is optimized for HPC systems using HPX for parallelism.

name: Simple Simulator
one_line_profile: High-performance physics simulator for robotics and manipulation
detailed_description: A physics simulator designed for robotics research, focusing on simplicity and performance. It supports rigid body dynamics and is used for testing control algorithms and robot learning.

name: MuJoCo-LiDAR
one_line_profile: High-performance LiDAR simulation for MuJoCo
detailed_description: A high-performance LiDAR simulation tool based on the MuJoCo physics engine. It supports multiple backends (CPU, Taichi, Jax) and integrates with ROS, enabling realistic sensor simulation for robotics research.

name: skrl
one_line_profile: Modular Reinforcement Learning library for robotics and physics simulations
detailed_description: skrl is a reinforcement learning library designed for modularity and readability. It supports PyTorch, JAX, and integrates with physics-based environments like NVIDIA Isaac Lab, Omniverse, and MuJoCo for robot learning.

name: BabelStream
one_line_profile: Memory bandwidth benchmark for diverse HPC architectures
detailed_description: BabelStream is a benchmark tool for measuring memory transfer rates (bandwidth) across a wide range of processing devices (CPUs, GPUs) and programming models (CUDA, OpenCL, Kokkos, SYCL, etc.). It is essential for evaluating hardware performance for scientific computing.

name: GeoTaichi
one_line_profile: Taichi-powered simulator for geophysical problems
detailed_description: A high-performance numerical simulator built with Taichi, designed for solving multiscale and multifield geophysical problems.

name: gpu-io
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated physics simulation library for the web
detailed_description: A library for performing GPU-accelerated physics simulations and mathematical computations directly in a web browser, supporting fluid dynamics, reaction-diffusion, and particle systems.

name: rakau
one_line_profile: C++17 N-body Barnes-Hut library for heterogeneous hardware architectures
detailed_description: A C++17 library implementing the Barnes-Hut N-body algorithm, designed for high performance on heterogeneous hardware architectures including CPUs and GPUs.

name: GPUMD
one_line_profile: General-purpose molecular dynamics simulation package for GPUs
detailed_description: A highly efficient molecular dynamics simulation package designed specifically for Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), enabling large-scale atomistic simulations.

name: Celeritas
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Monte Carlo transport code for high energy physics
detailed_description: A Monte Carlo transport code designed to accelerate high energy physics detector simulations by leveraging GPUs for improved throughput and energy efficiency.

name: perses
one_line_profile: Framework for alchemical free energy calculations and chemical space exploration
detailed_description: A Python framework for performing alchemical free energy calculations and exploring chemical space using expanded ensembles, built on top of OpenMM.

name: ufedmm
one_line_profile: Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) implementation for OpenMM
detailed_description: A Python library implementing Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) for enhanced sampling simulations using the OpenMM engine.

name: ParticleSolver
one_line_profile: CPU and GPU particle-based physics simulation library
detailed_description: A library providing CPU and GPU implementations of particle-based physics simulations, based on the Unified Particle Physics for Real-Time Application method.

name: FBPIC
one_line_profile: Spectral, quasi-3D Particle-In-Cell code for plasma physics on CPU and GPU
detailed_description: FBPIC is a Particle-In-Cell (PIC) code for relativistic plasma physics. It features a spectral cylindrical representation that allows for accurate and fast simulations, particularly suitable for laser-wakefield acceleration and plasma-based accelerators.

name: fdtd
one_line_profile: 3D electromagnetic FDTD simulator written in Python
detailed_description: A Python-based 3D electromagnetic Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) simulator. It provides a simple interface for defining geometries, sources, and detectors to simulate electromagnetic wave propagation, with optional GPU acceleration via PyTorch.

name: Synergia
one_line_profile: Accelerator modeling and simulation package
detailed_description: Synergia is a package for the modeling and simulation of particle accelerators, developed at Fermilab. It handles single-particle optics and collective effects like space charge and impedance in a parallel computing environment.

name: GSD
one_line_profile: File format library for HOOMD-blue data
detailed_description: GSD (General Simulation Data) is a file format specification and library for reading and writing simulation data, primarily designed for and used by the HOOMD-blue molecular dynamics engine. It handles efficient storage of particle trajectories and properties.

name: MuJoCo Warp
one_line_profile: GPU-optimized version of the MuJoCo physics simulator
detailed_description: A version of the MuJoCo physics engine optimized for NVIDIA GPUs using the Warp library. It enables massive parallelism for rigid body dynamics simulations, particularly useful for reinforcement learning and robotics research.

name: Grappa
one_line_profile: Machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field
detailed_description: Grappa is a machine-learned molecular mechanics force field that integrates with GROMACS and OpenMM. It aims to improve the accuracy of molecular dynamics simulations by using machine learning to parameterize force fields.

name: Stannum
one_line_profile: Bridge library fusing Taichi into PyTorch for differentiable physics
detailed_description: Stannum is a library that enables the integration of Taichi kernels into PyTorch's autograd graph. This allows researchers to build differentiable physics pipelines where Taichi handles the simulation and PyTorch handles the learning and optimization.

name: NVIDIA Isaac Sim
one_line_profile: Robotics simulation and synthetic data generation tool
detailed_description: NVIDIA Isaac Sim is a scalable robotics simulation application and synthetic data generation tool. It leverages GPU acceleration and physics simulation to create photorealistic, physically accurate virtual environments for developing and testing robots.

name: JAX-MD
one_line_profile: Differentiable, hardware-accelerated molecular dynamics in JAX
detailed_description: JAX-MD is a software package for performing molecular dynamics simulations using JAX. It is fully differentiable and runs on hardware accelerators (GPUs/TPUs), enabling research into machine-learned potentials and optimization of physical systems.

name: Metadynamics Plugin
one_line_profile: Metadynamics plugin for HOOMD-blue
detailed_description: A plugin for the HOOMD-blue simulation engine that implements metadynamics, an enhanced sampling technique. It allows users to perform free energy calculations and explore rare events in molecular simulations.

name: Kokkos FFT
one_line_profile: Shared-memory FFT library for the Kokkos ecosystem
detailed_description: A Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) library designed to work seamlessly with Kokkos views and execution spaces, enabling portable spectral analysis on CPUs and GPUs.

name: Kokkos Fortran Interop
one_line_profile: Interoperability tools for Fortran and Kokkos C++
detailed_description: A library facilitating the integration of modern C++ Kokkos performance kernels into legacy or mixed-language Fortran scientific applications.

name: Kokkos Kernels
one_line_profile: Math Kernels for Kokkos (BLAS, Sparse, Graph)

detailed_description: A scientific machine learning tool that utilizes Fourier Neural Operators (FNO) for coupled inversion tasks, specifically designed for monitoring and forecasting carbon sequestration processes in geophysics.

name: LAMP
one_line_profile: Deep learning-based surrogate model with joint evolution learning and mesh optimization
detailed_description: A surrogate modeling tool that jointly learns the evolution model of a physical system and optimizes computational costs via remeshing, presented at ICLR 2023.

name: KoopmanMPC_Quadrotor
one_line_profile: Koopman operator-based Model Predictive Control for quadrotor dynamics
detailed_description: A MATLAB toolkit implementing data-driven control using Koopman operator theory, specifically applied to the dynamics and control of quadrotors.

name: DL-ROM-Meth
one_line_profile: Deep learning-based reduced order models for nonlinear time-dependent PDEs
detailed_description: Implementation of deep learning-based reduced order models (DL-ROM) designed to solve nonlinear time-dependent parametrized Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) efficiently.

name: PhaseNO
one_line_profile: Phase Neural Operator for modeling dynamics
detailed_description: Implementation of the Phase Neural Operator, a specialized operator learning architecture designed to capture phase-dependent dynamics in physical systems.

name: gwsurrogate
one_line_profile: Interface to gravitational wave surrogate models
detailed_description: A Python package providing an easy-to-use interface for evaluating surrogate models of gravitational waveforms, used in astrophysics for efficient signal generation and analysis.

name: Diffusion-based-Flow-Prediction
one_line_profile: Uncertainty-aware surrogate models for airfoil flow simulations using diffusion models
detailed_description: Implementation of Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DDPM) as uncertainty-aware surrogates for predicting fluid flow around airfoils, enabling probabilistic simulation.

name: GAN-ROM
one_line_profile: GAN-based reduced-order model framework for time series prediction and data assimilation
detailed_description: A framework utilizing Generative Adversarial Networks (GAN) within a Reduced-Order Model (ROM) context to handle time series prediction, data assimilation, and uncertainty quantification for dynamical systems.

name: H_Kriging
one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of Hierarchical Kriging surrogate models
detailed_description: A MATLAB library for constructing Hierarchical Kriging models, a type of variable fidelity surrogate model that improves upon co-Kriging for multi-fidelity data fusion.

name: EasySurrogate
one_line_profile: Toolkit for creating surrogate models of multiscale systems
detailed_description: Part of the VECMA toolkit, this tool facilitates the creation and deployment of surrogate models specifically designed for multiscale simulations and uncertainty quantification.

name: Denovo-Pinal
one_line_profile: Text-guided de novo protein design model
detailed_description: A deep learning model for generating protein structures based on textual descriptions, enabling text-guided de novo protein design.

name: Koopman-Neural-Network-Training
one_line_profile: Software for training neural networks via Koopman operator theory
detailed_description: A MATLAB software package for optimizing and training neural networks by leveraging Koopman operator theory to linearize nonlinear dynamics in the latent space.

name: MACE
one_line_profile: Fast and accurate machine learning interatomic potentials with higher order equivariant message passing
detailed_description: MACE provides fast and accurate machine learning interatomic potentials using higher order equivariant message passing neural networks. It is designed for atomistic simulations in physics, chemistry, and materials science, enabling high-fidelity molecular dynamics and property prediction.

name: MOFSimBench
one_line_profile: Benchmark for evaluating universal ML interatomic potentials in MOF molecular modeling
detailed_description: MOFSimBench is a benchmark suite designed to evaluate the performance of universal machine learning interatomic potentials specifically for metal-organic frameworks (MOFs). It facilitates the assessment of model accuracy and transferability in complex molecular modeling tasks.

name: Molecules_Dataset_Collection
one_line_profile: Collection of molecular datasets for property inference validation
detailed_description: A collection of datasets containing molecular structures and properties, intended for the validation of property inference models in cheminformatics and molecular physics.

name: trackml-library
one_line_profile: Utilities for the TrackML particle tracking challenge
detailed_description: A Python library providing utilities for reading, processing, and analyzing data from the TrackML High Energy Physics particle tracking challenge. It assists in the development of algorithms for reconstructing particle trajectories.

name: Darwin
one_line_profile: Foundational large language model for natural science
detailed_description: Darwin is an open-source project dedicated to building a foundational large language model tailored for natural sciences, with a focus on physics, chemistry, and materials science, enabling scientific text understanding and potential property inference.

name: Open-Catalyst-Dataset
one_line_profile: Workflow and tools for the Open Catalyst Dataset
detailed_description: Provides workflows and tools for creating, managing, and analyzing the Open Catalyst Dataset, which is designed for training ML models to simulate catalytic reactions and predict molecular energy and forces.

name: The Well
one_line_profile: Large-scale collection of physics simulation datasets
detailed_description: The Well is a massive (15TB) collection of physics simulation datasets covering various physical systems (fluids, mechanics, etc.), designed to serve as a benchmark for physics-informed machine learning and foundation models.

name: QuantumLattices.jl
one_line_profile: Julia package for constructing quantum lattice systems
detailed_description: QuantumLattices.jl is a Julia package designed for the construction and manipulation of quantum lattice systems, facilitating numerical computations in quantum many-body physics.

name: ANI1x_datasets

detailed_description: Provides the ANI-1ccx and ANI-1x datasets, containing coupled-cluster and density functional theory (DFT) properties for organic molecules, used for training machine learning potentials.

name: ANI-1xnr

name: mlipx

name: MoleculeNet

name: LAMBench

name: ANI-1 Dataset

name: ASE_ANI

name: Matbench Discovery

name: JARVIS-FF

detailed_description: A repository containing data and LAMMPS scripts for the evaluation of interatomic potentials and force-fields, part of the JARVIS-FF project.

name: Matbench

name: pymatgen

name: lineshape_tools

name: qm9pack

name: go-trackml

detailed_description: A Go package designed to simplify reading and processing data from the High Energy Physics Tracking Machine Learning challenge (TrackML). It provides utilities for data loading and evaluation metrics specific to particle tracking tasks.

name: simple-equivariant-gnn

detailed_description: A concise and reusable PyTorch implementation of E(n) Equivariant Graph Neural Networks (EGNN). This architecture is critical in AI for Science for modeling particle dynamics, molecular structures, and many-body systems where rotation and translation equivariance are required.

name: TrackML_CombinatorialTracker

name: matbench-genmetrics

name: kaggle-trackML-solution

name: jarvis_leaderboard

detailed_description: The official codebase for the JARVIS leaderboard, facilitating the benchmarking of various materials design methods (AI, DFT, etc.). It allows researchers to compare performance on standardized tasks within materials science and physics.

name: CVXR

detailed_description: CVXR is an R package that provides an object-oriented modeling language for convex optimization, allowing users to formulate problems in a natural mathematical syntax.

name: cvxpygen

name: dmcp

name: dsp

name: qcqp

name: CVXOPT

name: CVXPY

name: cvxpylayers

detailed_description: A MATLAB-based application and framework for testing and executing various numerical optimization algorithms (like L-BFGS, CG, Levenberg-Marquardt) with a GUI for visualization.

name: hyper-engine
one_line_profile: Bayesian hyper-parameters optimization library
detailed_description: A Python library for Bayesian hyperparameter optimization of machine learning models, facilitating automated model tuning.

name: moead-py
one_line_profile: Python implementation of MOEA/D algorithm
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Multi-Objective Evolutionary Algorithm based on Decomposition (MOEA/D), used for solving multi-objective optimization problems.

name: pyOptSparse
one_line_profile: Framework for large-scale nonlinear constrained optimization
detailed_description: An object-oriented framework designed for formulating and solving large-scale nonlinear constrained optimization problems, particularly suited for Multidisciplinary Design Optimization (MDO).

name: cyipopt
one_line_profile: Cython interface for IPOPT solver
detailed_description: A Python wrapper (via Cython) for the IPOPT (Interior Point OPTimizer) library, enabling efficient solution of large-scale nonlinear optimization problems from Python.

name: MGL-GPR
one_line_profile: Evolutionary algorithms library including Genetic Programming and Differential Evolution
detailed_description: MGL-GPR is a Common Lisp library implementing evolutionary algorithms, specifically Genetic Programming for evolving typed expressions and Differential Evolution for optimization tasks.

name: BoTorch
one_line_profile: Bayesian optimization library built on PyTorch
detailed_description: BoTorch is a library for Bayesian Optimization built on PyTorch. It provides a modular and easily extensible interface for composing Bayesian optimization primitives, including probabilistic models, acquisition functions, and optimizers.

name: TorchOpt
one_line_profile: Efficient library for differentiable optimization built upon PyTorch
detailed_description: TorchOpt is an efficient library for differentiable optimization built upon PyTorch. It is designed to support meta-learning and other optimization tasks where gradients need to be propagated through the optimization process.

name: humpday
one_line_profile: Benchmarking and selection framework for global black-box derivative-free optimizers
detailed_description: Humpday provides Elo ratings and benchmarking for global black-box derivative-free optimizers. It helps users select the best optimizer for their specific problem by comparing performance across various strategies.

name: Tutel
one_line_profile: Optimized Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) library for large-scale model training
detailed_description: Tutel is a high-performance Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) library that optimizes the training of large-scale AI models. It supports various precision formats and is used for optimizing deep learning workloads.

name: AOC Digital Twin
one_line_profile: Digital twin simulator for Analog-Optical Computer targeting constrained quadratic optimization
detailed_description: This repository contains the digital twin of the Analog-Optical Computer (AOC), a novel in-memory analog AI accelerator. It is used for simulating inference of fixed-point AI models and solving constrained quadratic optimization problems.

name: CAMINO
one_line_profile: Python-CasADi-based package for solving mixed-integer nonlinear programs (MINLPs)
detailed_description: CAMINO is a Python package based on CasADi that provides several algorithms for solving mixed-integer nonlinear programs (MINLPs), useful in various scientific and engineering optimization contexts.

name: pix2latent
one_line_profile: Tool for projecting images into class-conditional generative networks (GAN inversion)
detailed_description: pix2latent provides code and tools for transforming and projecting real images into the latent space of class-conditional generative networks (GAN inversion), which is a type of inverse problem in computer vision.

name: lbfgsb_wrapper
one_line_profile: Java wrapper for the Fortran L-BFGS-B optimization algorithm
detailed_description: This library provides a Java wrapper around the standard Fortran implementation of the L-BFGS-B algorithm, allowing Java applications to perform bound-constrained optimization.

name: ParamHelpers
one_line_profile: Helper functions for parameter handling in black-box optimization
detailed_description: ParamHelpers offers tools for defining and handling parameters in black-box optimization, tuning, and machine learning tasks within the R ecosystem.

name: bbotk
one_line_profile: Black-box optimization framework for R
detailed_description: bbotk is a comprehensive framework for black-box optimization in R, providing classes and methods to define optimization problems and interface with various solvers.

name: mlrMBO

detailed_description: mlrMBO is a flexible and comprehensive R toolbox for Model-Based Optimization (MBO), also known as Bayesian Optimization, suitable for optimizing expensive black-box functions.

name: cvxpy_codegen
one_line_profile: Embedded code generation for convex optimization based on CVXPY
detailed_description: cvxpy_codegen enables the generation of embedded C code for solving convex optimization problems defined in CVXPY, facilitating the deployment of optimization solvers on embedded systems.

name: differentiable-simulation-am

detailed_description: This tool leverages automatic differentiation to perform optimization for additive manufacturing processes, enabling differentiable simulation and inverse design.

name: Pweave

detailed_description: Pweave is a scientific report generator and literate programming tool for Python, similar to Knitr for R. It captures results and plots from data analysis (numpy, scipy, matplotlib) into formatted reports.

name: BayesBoost

detailed_description: BayesBoost implements Bayesian Optimization using XGBoost as the surrogate model, providing a Scikit-learn compatible API for optimizing hyperparameters or other black-box functions.

name: pybo

detailed_description: pybo is a Python package designed for modular Bayesian optimization, allowing users to configure and run Bayesian optimization loops for black-box functions.

name: differentiable-shadow-mapping

detailed_description: This library implements differentiable shadow mapping, enabling efficient inverse graphics applications where shadow parameters need to be optimized via gradient descent.

name: dro
